Hace ms de 10 aos y medio se dedica a la venta de comida que realiza en su misma casa, asimismo lo expende de manera ambulante. Cuando hay festividades en su localidad sale con su pequea carpa a ofrecer sus platillos y cada 15 das realiza actividades como: polladas y parrilladas. En ocasiones la ayudan sus hijos pero generalmente realiza sola este negocio todos los das, por ello necesita siempre suministrarse de ingredientes bsicos para la preparacin de sus ricos platillos. Su negocio ha demostrado tener buenas ganancias que la satisfacen y la motivan a continuar, una de sus metas es tener un restaurante campestre. Es su segundo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita ya que le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra de algunos ingredientes al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old, widowed, and lives at the home of her parents with her two children. She has been selling food from her home for 10 years and also offers her dishes as a street vendor. Whenever there are local festivals, Sonia will set up a small tent where she sells her dishes. Every fifteen days she goes out to sell roasted chicken and grilled meats. Her children occasionally help her, but she generally works alone every day at her business. For this reason, she needs to always be stocked with basic ingredients for preparing her rich dishes. Her business has demonstrated that she is able to generate a satisfactory income, so she is motivated to continue working. One of her goals is to own a country restaurant.

This is her second loan with MFP. Sonia is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, she is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks those responsible for approving her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of a few ingredients in bulk.

loan.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loan.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a businessman who runs a posho mill. It has been five years since he started the business. He runs the business with one employee.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benson has benefited through the loans. He has improved his business and can now provide for his family. He dreams of opening other outlets for his business in five years. With the 80,000 Kes loan, he will add stocks of maize for his mill.

loan.use: To buy maize

loan.name: Confort Oladogni

texts.fr: Mademoiselle confort a 45 ans et mre dun enfant. Elle fait la vente de produits cosmtiques pour rpondre aux besoins de son enfant. Elle a commenc son activit en 2003 et achte les produits au grand march de Lom. Ensuite elle les revend au march local de hedzranawo. Elle sollicite un crdit pour acheter de nouveaux lots de produits.
texts.en: Ms. Confort is 45 years old and has one child. She sells cosmetic products in order to support her child. She launched this business in 2003. She stocks up at the big market of Lom. She then resells her goods at the local market of Hedzranawo. She is seeking a credit to buy a new supply of goods.

loan.use: Purchasing cosmetic products

loan.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doa Dora, resiD. en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento D. San Miguel, tiene 42 aos D. edad, su familia est compuesta por: su esposo y dos hijos D. 18 y 14 aos D. edad, que aun son dependientes, Ella administra una tienda donD. ofrece artculos para el hogar, lo inicio hace 10 aos, trabajando D. lunes a Domingo. Actualmente est solicitando un prstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando mercadera como: huevos, gaseosas, aceite, pan y granos bsicos. Este prstamo ser un gran apoyo para doa Dora pues solamente D. esta manera ella pueD. ir aumentando el negocio. Adems estar ayudando a su familia, pues garantizndoles un negocio competente. Las aspiraciones con respecto al prstamo son realizar una buena inversin, seguir fortaleciendo el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y velar por todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Dora lives in Nueva Guadalupe in the department of San Miguel. She is 42 years old, and her family includes her husband and two children aged 18 and 14 years, who are still dependents. She runs a store where she offers household goods. She started the business 10 years ago, and she works there every day.
Now she requests a loan to invest in the business, buying merchandise such as: eggs, soft drinks, cooking oil, bread and staple grains. This loan will be a great support for Dora, since only in this way can she expand her business. In addition, she will be helping her family by ensuring that the business remains viable.
Her aspirations with regard to the loan are to make a good investment, to continue to strengthen the business, and to help her children with their studies and proviD. for all of their needs.

loan.use: to buy eggs, soft drinks, cooking oil, bread and staple grains

loan.name: Idekel 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Gloria pertenece al grupo Idekel 1 & 2, nombre tomado de la Biblia, ya que es un grupo formado por base cristiana, cada uno de ellos das a das realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Los Alcarrizos, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales, o de manera ambulante. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosmticos, alimentos, entre otros productos miscelneos.
Gloria posee una familia conformada por sus dos hijos y su esposo. Sus hijos asisten a la escuela, y sus planes como familia, los lleva a trabajar y planificar un futuro mejor, donde sus hijos puedan completar su educacin superior y su negocio pueda prosperar y ser un negocio familiar.
El negocio de Gloria es la venta de calzado, lleva ya alrededor de 4 aos, el cual inicio vendido zapatos por catalogo. Gloria ha tomado ya su 6to. prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los prstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo prstamo ser invertido en la compra de calzados para mujeres, de diferentes estilos, colores y tamaos.
Su historia representa a los dems miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayora ha emigrado hacia la Repblica Dominicana desde Hait, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Repblica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energa elctrica constante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the 'Idekel 1 & 2 group. The name is taken from the Bible since this is a group with a Christian base. Every day, each member of the group carries out their business activities in the town of Los Alcarrizos. Some have their own businesses established in their own homes and / or premises, while others do not sell from a fixed location. Most of the group's members sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products.
Gloria's family consists of her two children and her husband. Her children go to school. Gloria works for her family and plans a better future where her children can complete their higher education and her business can prosper and become a family business.
Gloria's business is selling shoes and she has been in the business for around 4 years. She started out selling shoes from a catalog. This is Gloria's 6th loan from Esperanza Internacional and she feels very grateful because her previous loans have enabled her to make progress and invest in her business. She will invest this new loan in buying women's shoes in different styles, colors and sizes.
Gloria's story is representative of the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who mainly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities. This area, like many other poor areas in the Dominican Republic, lacks a reliable supply of drinking water and electricity.

loan.use: To buy shoes

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 aos, es separada y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. su niez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desD. entonces sigue cultivando sus terrenos que ha heredado D. sus padres, lo que principalmente siembra es la papa y el maz as como tambin algunas hortalizas como la cebolla, lechuga y zanahorias que despus D. su cosecha lo lleva a vender a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. su zona. Sus 3 hijos la apoyan en todo este proceso D. cultivo que requiere fertilizar y cuidar las plantas y as se ahorra en la mano D. obra y tener un poco ms D. ganancias. La siembra en aos anteriores no le fue muy bien debido a los cambios climticos pero a pesar D. esta dificultad siempre tiene disponible el alimento necesario para su familia adems parte D. lo cosechado, aprovecha para preparar comidas que venD. todas las tardes cerca D. su casa. En adelante va a incrementar las semillas que va a sembrar. Es su sexto crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita ya que le ser muy til en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir para comprar sacos D. abono para su campaa D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, separated, and lives in her own home with her three children. She has been farming since she was a young girl and continues to cultivate the land she inherited from her parents. Rosa grows mainly potatoes and corn, but she also has other crops such as onions, lettuce, and carrots. After harvesting her crops, she sells them to merchants at the different markets in the area. Her three children help with the entire farming process, including fertilizing and caring for the plants. This saves her the cost of labor so that she can keep a little more of her earnings. Her harvests in previous years have not been good due to changes in weather. Despite these difficulties, Rosa has always been able to proviD. the necessary food for her family by setting asiD. part of her harvest. She also prepares food to sell every afternoon near her home. Going forward, Rosa wants to acquire more seeds so that she can begin planting.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Rosa is very happy to know that she has financial support, so she always demonstrates responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. She also thanks everyone who approved her loan request because the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in sacks of compost for the planting season.

loan.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loan.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es: Doa Ana, tiene 46 aos de edad, vive con sus hijos de las de edades 26, 23, 18 y 16, residen en Lolotique departamento de San Miguel, doa Ana se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, este negocio fue iniciado por un familiar y que despus paso a manos de doa Ana, tiene ya 4 aos de existir y trabaja de lunes a domingo. Ella est solicitando un prstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar las pupusas, como maz, quesillo, chicharrn, tomates, papel y lea, estos productos son muy necesarios en el negocio, pues son los ingredientes y materiales que hacen posible la venta. Las aspiraciones de doa Ana es seguir incrementando el negocio, para que as su familia cuente con ms ingresos y puedan seguir estudiando sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doa Ana is 46 years old and lives with her children (ages 26, 23, 18, and 16) in Lolotique in the Department of San Miguel. She sells pupusas and tortillas. This business was started by a relative and afterwards placed in the hands of Doa Ana. Her business has been in existence for four years and she works Monday through Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making pupusas such as corn, cheese, pork, tomatoes, paper, and firewood. These products are necessary since they include ingredients and materials that make her business possible.

Doa Ana has aspirations of continuing the growth of her business so that her family can have more income and her children can move forward in their studies.

loan.use: Purchase corn, cheese, pork, tomatoes, paper, and firewood

loan.name: Mibame

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Mibame a 22 ans. Elle est ne Tsvi et habite quartier Hdzranawo. Elle fait le commerce de produits d'alimtentation gnrale. Elle a commenc en 2008 et s'approvisionne au grand march de Lom. Elle revend les produits au march de hdzranawo. Elle sollicite un prt pour se rapprovisionner.
texts.en: Ms. Mibame is 22 years old. She is born in Tsvi and lives in the Hdzranawo district. She sells general food products. She has started this business in 2008 and stocks up at the big market of Lom. She then resells her goods at the Hdzranawo market. She is seeking a loan in order to replenish her stock.

loan.use: Purchasing general food products

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buying materials to repair her roof: shingles, nails, wood and paint

loan.name: Jacira

texts.es: Jacira tiene 22 aos, vive en casa de sus padres en compaa de su madre, sus hermanos y su hijo pequeo. Desde su niez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y recientemente desde hace 1 ao tiene sus terrenos que ha heredado para sembrar principalmente quinua, maz y pastizales que le permite mejores ganancias a comparacin de otros cultivos, es por eso que diariamente por las maanas sale a verificar sus terrenos y prevenir la plaga de insectos que pudieran afectar sus cosechas. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su madre y en ocasiones la de sus hermanos, pero sus esfuerzos no solo quedan en las tareas agrcolas; asimismo expende comida a media maana y a la hora de almuerzo que es una ganancia adicional a la de su actividad agrcola. Considera que la venta de su cosecha es muy rentable sobre todo la venta de quinua, porque lo pueden adquirir a un bajo precio en el mercado de su localidad. Es por esta razn que continuar dedicndose a sembrar estos productos en ms extensiones de terreno. Es su segundo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita ya que le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su prxima campaa de siembra.
texts.en:
Jacira is 22 years old. She lives with her with her mother, her siblings and her small child. Since she was young she has worked in agriculture. A year ago she inherited land in which she grows quinoa, corn and grass (for grazing) that allow her to earn a greater income, by comparison to other crops. Every day, in the morning, she inspects her crops in order to protect them agains harmful insects that could jeopardize the harvest. She sometimes receives help from her mother and on other occasions, from her siblings. Not only does Jacira work her land but she also sells food in the mid morning and at lunchtime. This provides an additional income to the earnings from her agricultural work. She feels that her crop is profitable, especially in the area of quinoa sales. She is able to sell it for a affordable price at her local market. Given its profitability, Jacira will set apart more area of her land to continue growing these same crops.
This will be Jacira's second loan with MFP. She is very glad knowing that she has financial support and she is happy to be a part of her communal bank because all of its members are very responsible, supportive people. She thanks all those who contribute to the loan she is requesting since it will be very instrumental in furthering her business. Jacira plans to use the loan to invest in bags of manure and fertilizers for the next planting season.

loan.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer.

loan.name: La Flor De Limon Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Flor de Limn y est conformado por 9 integrantes, est ubicado en Quintana Roo, Mxico. La seora Jacinta C. es miembro del grupo y es vecina de la comunidad Maya de Limones, ella tiene 46 aos, vive en una casa de madera y techo de palma de la regin que se llama huano, le gusta, pero quiere algo mejor para sus hijos, ya que no le gustara que crecieran en un solo cuarto y sin privacidad. La seora Jacinta se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de composturas, arreglos y encargos de sus vecinos, pero comenta que si tuviera una mquina de coser elctrica el trabajo seria ms rpido. Ella est contenta por el crdito que solicito ya que quiere ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes.
texts.en: This group is called Flor de Limn ["Lemon Flower"], and it is made up of 9 members. It is located in Quintana Roo, Mxico. Jacinta C. is a member of the group and a neighbor living in the community of Maya de Limones. She is 46 years old and lives in a wooden house with a thatched roof made from a local palm called huano. She likes it, but she would like something better for her children, because she does not want them to grow up in a single room without any privacy. Jacinta's business is tailoring; she makes all types of garments, repairs clothing, and takes custom orders from her neighbors. However, she comments that if she had an electric sewing machine, her work would go more quickly. She is happy about the loan she is requesting, because she would like to expand her business and be able to satisfy the requests of all of her customers.

loan.use: Buying an electric sewing machine

loan.name: Osmar Alberto

texts.es: Osmar, casado su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada, sus planes en mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. Con su propio negoci inicindolo con apoyo su familia. Se le ha presentado dificultades como es el alza de los perecederos. Proyecto ampliar su negocio con mayores cantidades y variedades. Agradece a la financiera por apoyo con el prstamo ya que ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construccin como. Cemento, arena, piedra, bloques, zinc, camisas entre otros permitindole mejora el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Osmar is a married man whose wife works in a private business. He has plans to improve the standard of living of his family through his own business, starting it with the help of his family. Some difficulties have come up such as the increase in the price of products. He plans to expand his business with larger quantities and more variety.
He appreciates the financing assistance of the loan which will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, blocks, zinc, work shirts, and other products, permitting him to improve his standard of living.

loan.use: Purchase of construction materials

loan.name: Ruth Y Esther 2 Group

texts.es:
Anilesis pertenece al grupo Ruth y Esther 2, un grupo formado por 5 mujeres, dedicada a la venta de diferentes productos como: Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosmticos, alimentos, entre otros productos miscelneos. Cada una de ellos das a das realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Samana, es unas de las comunidad, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales, o de manera ambulante.
Anilesis posee una familia conformada por su su hija y su pareja. En una vivienda alquilada, la cual pagan gracias al esfuerzo que ambos (padre y madre) ya que ambos llevan ingresos a su vivienda. Sus actividades favoritas son trabajar y cuidar a su familia, su desafi mas difcil y el cual es su principal reto por cumplir de poder tener su casa propia; logrando as, cuando lo pueda realizar, su mas anhelado sueo, junto a sus deseos de poder educar y guiar por el buen camino a su hija. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, para un publico general, compra por encargo, lo que necesitan sus clientes. Anilesis lleva ya 5 aos realizando esta actividad de negocio.
Anilesis ha tomado ya 4 prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los prstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo prstamo ser invertido en la compra de zapatos, y algunos artculos que ha identificado con muchas demandas.
Su historia representa a los dems miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayora ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Hait, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energa elctrica constante.
texts.en:
Anilesis is part of the Ruth and Esther 2 Group. The group consists of five women who engage in different businesses selling clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products. All of them conduct their business activities every day in the city of Samana. They have established businesses in their community whether it be in their own homes, from storefronts, or as street vendors.

Anilesis has a family that consists of her daughter and her partner. They live in a rented home that they are able to afford as a result of the household income that she and her partner earn. Her favorite activities are working and taking care of her family. The most difficult challenge she faces is being able to acquire her own home. Once she is able to achieve that, her greatest wish is to provide her daughter an education and guide her along the right path. Her business involves selling new clothing to the general public. She purchases what her customers need. Anilesis has been in this business for five years.

She has already taken four loans with Esperanza International. Anilesis is extremely grateful for these loans because she has been able to advance and invest in her business. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes and articles of clothing that are in great demand.

Anelesis is representative of other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in poor communities that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loan.use: Purchase clothing & shoes in different styles

loan.name: Orlando Rafael

texts.es: Orlando casado, su esposa de ocupacin comerciante, tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, electrodomsticos y artculos del hogar. Proyectos para corto plazo la compra del local, convertirse en distribuidores y tambin el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Iniciaron con esfuerzo propios, se le ha presentado al dificulta de falta de financiamientos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y condicin de vida. El prstamo que solicitad ser invertido en la compra de mercadera como: ropas de dama, caballero, nios, artculos escolares, productos para el hogar como cuadros, adornos, platos entre otros. Obteniendo un incremento de ventas e igual de ganancia.
texts.en:
Orlando is married. He and his wife are merchants and have their own business selling clothing, electric household appliances and basic home items. Their goals are to buy their working space, become distributors and upgrade their house. They started their business without any assistance but have had some difficulty with finances. They are grateful with the finance company for the support which will allow them to improve their living conditions and business.
The loan will be utilized to buy general merchandise like clothing for women, men and children, school supplies, household items, pictures, knick-knacks and dishes. This would help them to increase sales and profits.

loan.use: to buy general merchandise

loan.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto, construir una pequea habitacin, porque actualmente estn viviendo en casa de su suegra, en donde ya se les dio un pedacito de terreno para que construyan una habitacin para el bebe que ellos tienen, ya que es un matrimonio joven que tiene muchos proyectos a futuro y son muy trabajadores, es por eso que decidieron ser padres, por este motivo que ellos, estn construyendo esa otra habitacin, para tener un poco mas de privacidad y darle a su familia un hogar
texts.en: Sr. Roberto will construct a small house, because he and his wife are now living in the home of his mother-in-law, where she has already given them a little piece of land so that they can build a house for their baby. Since they are a young married couple, they have many projects for the future, and they are very hard-working. This is why they decided to become parents, and this is why they are constructing another house, so that they can have a little more privacy and give their family a home.

loan.use: Construct a room

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Pay for technical maintenance on his car, as well as upholstering the seats.

loan.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Madame Hawa Guiss est une femme de 46 ans qui habite dans lun des quartiers environnants de la localit de baye laye. Elle est marie et sactive dans la teinture depuis 2004. Madame Guiss exerce paralllement la vente de tissus et autres articles divers. Cest par amour du mtier quelle a choisi lactivit de teinture. En priode de veille de fte (Tabaski, Korite, etc.) elle est habitue confectionner des boubous en thioup qui sont destins la vente. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis mars 2001. Elle a dj rembours 7 prts antrieurs. Elle sollicite un crdit de 300 000 frs prvu pour lachat de produits et de tissus en vue de renforcer son activit de teinture. Madame Guiss compte sur son financement pour atteindre son autonomie financire qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins primaires.
texts.en: Mrs. Hawa Guiss is a 46-year old woman who lives in an area close to the town of Baye-Laye. She is married has been dyeing clothes since 2004. In addition, she also sells fabrics and other miscellaneous items. She selected dyeing because she enjoyed it. Before festivities, such as Tabaski (the Muslim holiday of Eid) and Korite (corresponding to the ending of Ramadan), she usually makes traditional outfits of dyed cloth for sale. She has been a member of the Yoff branch since March 2001. She already repaid seven prior loans. She is seeking a credit of 300,000 West African Francs in order to purchase goods and fabrics in order to bolster her business. Mrs. Guisse counts on her loan in order to achieve financial autonomy and be able to provide for her basic needs.

loan.use: Purchasing fabrics and dyeing supplies

loan.name: Susana Tomasa

texts.es: La seora Susana Tomasa H. H. D. S. se dedica a la venta D. cmida y bebidas hace diez aos aproximadamente, la solicitante vive con sus padres y su hijo mayor la cual ayuda con la canasta familiar. Solicita el crdito por quiere ampliar su negocio comprando ms mercadera y otras cosas adicionales para su negocio. Se propone otorgarle el crdito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales adems tiene experiencia acrediticia.
texts.en:
Susana Tomasa H. H. D. S. has been selling food and beverages for approximately ten years. This loan applicant lives with her parents and her oldest son, who helps her pay the family's bills.
She is applying for the loan because she wants to buy more merchandise and other items for her business in order to expand. It has been decided to grant her the loan because she has good business and personal references and has a good credit history.

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Miramar Femenino 2 Group

texts.es:
Yesenia es L. coordinadora del Grupo Miramar Femenina 2. Su familia est compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposo, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafos ms difciles ha echar su negocio hacia adelante, ya que resulta difcil mantener cualquier negocio si no hay un enfoque a crecer y superar todos los retos.
Yessenia est muy emocionada D. recibir su cuarto prstamo en Esperanza Internacional. ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 5 aos. Hasta ahora Yesenia ha vendido solo carne D. res, en L. actualidad desea invertir este nuevo prstamo en L. compra D. pollos y cerdo, y poder comprar con un mayor capital, a un mejor suplidor. ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para cubrir algunas necesidades en su familia y aprovechar para ahorrar.
Est asociada D. Esperanza comenz con nosotros porque deseas echar su negocio adelante, el cual requera D. capital para crecer. Su historia est siendo usada para representar a los dems miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayora ha emigrado hacia L. Repblica Dominicana desD. Hait, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. Repblica Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energa elctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una D. las comunidades D. mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of the 'Miramar Femenina 2' group. Her family consists of her four children and her husband. Both of them (father and mother) have educated and raised their children. Yesenia tells us that her most difficult challenge has been getting ahead in her business since it is difficult to keep any business going if there is no focus on growing and overcoming challenges.
Yesenia is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around 5 years. Up until now, Yesenia has only sold beef. She would like to invest this new loan in buying chickens and pigs. She would also like to be able to buy with more capital from a better supplier. She will use the profits she makes to cover some of her family's needs and will also save some money.
Yesenia started working with us because she wanted to get ahead in her business which needed capital in order to grow. We are using her story to represent the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who have mainly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans. In general they live in very poor communities. This area, like many other poor areas of the Dominican Republic, lacks a reliable supply of drinking water and electricity. This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities, in the north of the city.

loan.use: To expand and diversify her meat products

loan.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela embroiders hats, scarves, and sweaters for children, but will also make clothing for adults upon request. Mariela is going to use her loan to buy more fabrics and decorative objects for her clothes. She likes to add pompoms to the end of hats and other accessories to make fun clothing that children will enjoy wearing. Mariela's business has grown since she first started selling children's clothes and now she sells her clothes in another woman's store, but she dreams of owning her own store someday.
Mariela is a mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She hopes her children will continue to be successful in school and will go on to have successful careers after they finish school.

loan.use: To purchase more fabrics and embroidery materials

loan.name: Mujeres De Suenos Y Metas 2 Group

texts.es:
Cipriana es la coordinadora del Grupo Mujeres de suenos y metas 2. Su familia est compuesta por 4 hijos y su pareja, el cual es el padre de sus hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, en una de las comunidades de mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte de la ciudad, en unas de sus comunidades rurales.
Cipriana est muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto prstamo en Esperanza Internacional. Ella opera un negocio de venta de comida rpida, en un puesto frente a su casa, su especialidad es comidas fritas. Va a invertir este nuevo prstamo en la compra de ingredientes como pollo, pltanos, aceite, carbn, un caldero para cocinar. Sus ganancias van a ser ahorradas para poder en un futuro poder tener un pequeo restaurante en su comunidad, lo que en Repblica Dominicana le llaman un comedor. Este es uno de sus suenos al igual que pode tener una buena vivienda, donde pueda descansar y vivir segura.
Est asociada de Esperanza comenz con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son ms flexibles y a un menor inters. Su historia est siendo usada para representar a los dems miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayora ha emigrado hacia la Repblica Dominicana desde Hait, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Repblica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energa elctrica constante.
texts.en:
Cipriana is the coordinator for the group Mujeres de Sueos y Metas 2 (Women with Dreams and Goals 2). Her family consists of her four children and her partner who is the father of her children. They live in Santo Domingo in one of the poorest communities located north of the city. This community is in a rural area.

Cipriana is extremely excited about receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza International. She manages a fast food business from a stand in front of her house. Her specialty is fried food. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of supplies such as chicken, plantains, oil, charcoal, and a pot for cooking. Her earnings are being saved for the future so that she can open a small restaurant in her community, otherwise known as a comedor in the Dominican Republic. This is one of her dreams along with having a nice house where she can rest and live securely.

The group started with Esperanza because of the flexible payments and low interest rate. Ciprianas story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in poor communities that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loan.use: Purchase chicken, plantains, oil, charcoal, and a pot for cooking

loan.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Miguel, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, Mxico, est integrado por 7 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la seora Cecilia M. M. va a comprar mercanca azcar por kilo, huevo por kilo, papel higinico, aceite por litro, la seora Margarita M. Aragn va a comprar mercanca jabn, azcar por kilo, aceite por litro, huevo por kilo, sabritas, refrescos, la seora Roberta M. M. va a comprar mercanca refrescos, jugos, jabn, chiles en vinagre, azcar, huevo, aceite, la seora Lina C. Hernndez va a comprar mercanca sabritas, refrescos, jugos por caja para surtir su negocio, la seora Alicia E. N. va a comprar harina, azcar, huevo, mantequilla, esencias y una batidora para su negocio, la seora Virginia R. A. va a comprar hojas de maz, maz, manteca, una cazuela, para realizar sus tamales, la seora Alma Amrica F. R. va a comprar refrescos, pepsicola por caja, jarrito, coca cola por mayoreo. La seora Roberta es la representante del grupo ella tiene 50 aos de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos son Luis Enrique de 10 aos de edad est estudiando la primaria, Arseo de 20 aos de edad se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, Nayely tiene 17 aos de edad no estudia le ayuda a su mama a atender la tienda. La seora Roberta tiene su tienda de abarrotes y solicito su prstamo para surtir su tienda va a comprar azcar, jabn, cloro, refrescos, sabritas, pan bimbo, galletas, barcel, arroz, azcar, leche, papel higinico, agua purificada, frijol, platos y vasos desechables, inicio su negocio hace 10 aos tenan dinero ahorrado, su esposo se fue a estados unidos a trabajar y despus ella tambin se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar en una lavandera, ella estuvo 2 aos y medio y su esposo 3 aos, ella le mandaba a su mama y se lo fue guardando en el Banco, su esposo tambin fue ahorrando le mandaba a su hermano y lo fue guardando en el banco lo que mandaba y cuando regresaron le entregaron el dinero que fueron ahorrando de ah compraron el terreno, construyeron su casa y surtieron su tienda. La seora Roberta tambin tiene su negocio de alfarera elabora cazuelas y ollas de diferentes tamaos, los jarros los elabora en da de muertos su esposo y ella trabajan en la alfarera y su hija en la tienda. Atlacahualoya es un pueblo donde les gusto a sus hijos vivir su mam y sus hermanos llegaron ah a trabajar en el campo y se quedaron a vivir ah y como su mama cuidaba a sus hijos ellos ya no quisieron regresar a San Marcos y se quedaron a vivir en Atlacahualoya a ellos les gusta porque es tranquilo siembran cebolla, guajes del verde, celebran la fiesta de San Miguel el 29 de septiembre hay feria, primeras comuniones, bailes, toros. Su negocia a ayudado a su familia a tener dinero para los gastos de su hijo para la escuela, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son arreglar su casa ponerle azulejos, sus planes y esperanzas son sus hijos sern los que hicieran algo mas, les va a dejar su casa para ellos, ya si quieren seguir ya ellos vern, los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacin Realidad les damos las gracias por sus prstamos y que nos sigan prestando, espeR. no quedar mal, les agradecemos mucho porque nos estn ayudando a crecer en nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "San Miguel," and it is located in the community of Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of 7 women who know each other and are neighbors. They are Seora Cecilia M. M., who is going to buy merchandise: sugar by the kilo, eggs by the kilo, toilet paper, and oil by the liter; Seora Margarita M. Aragn is going to buy merchandise: soap, sugar by the kilo, oil by the liter, eggs by the kilo, Sabritas chips, and soft drinks; Seora Roberta M. M. is going to buy merchandise: soft drinks, juices, soap, peppers in vinegar, sugar, eggs, and oil; Seora Lina C. Hernndez is going to buy merchandise: Sabritas chips, soft drinks, and juices by the case to stock her business; Seora Alicia E. N. is going to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, fragrances, and a mixer for her business; Seora Virginia R. A. is going to buy corn husks, corn, lard, and a casserole to make her tamales; Seora Alma Amrica F. R. is going to buy soft drinks, PepsiCola by the case, pitchers, and CocaCola wholesale.
Seora Roberta is the representative of the group. She is 50 years old and is married, with three children: Luis Enrique is 10 years old and is in primary school; Arseo, who is 20, left for the United States to work; Nayely, who is 17, is not in school but helps her mother tend the store. Seora Roberta has a grocery store and is applying for the loan to stock her store. She is going to buy sugar, soap, bleach, soft drinks, Sabritas chips, Bimbo bread, crackers, Barcel snacks, rice, sugar, milk, toilet paper, purified water, beans, and disposable plates and glasses. She began her business 10 years ago with money they had saved. Her husband went to the United States to work, and later she also went to the United States to work in a laundry. She was there for two and a half years and her husband for three years. She sent money to her mother and she kept it in the bank. Her husband also saved and sent money to his brother, who kept what he sent in the bank. When they came back, her mother and her husband's brother turned over the money they had saved and then they bought land, built their house, and stocked her store. Seora Roberta also has a pottery business. She makes casseroles and pots of different sizes. She makes jars on the Day of the Dead. She and her husband work in the pottery business and their daughter works in the store. Atlacahualoya is a town where her children like to live. Her mother and her brothers came there to work in the fields and stayed there to live, and since her mother was taking care of their children, they didn't want to go back to San Marcos and stayed in Atlacahualoya to live. They like it because it is peaceful. They plant onions and green calabashes. They celebrate the fiesta of San Miguel on the 29th of September. There are fairs, first communions, dances, and bullfights. Her business has helped her family to have money for the school expenses of their son. The improvements that she wants to make on her house are to fix it up and put on tiles. Her plans and hopes are that her children will do something more. She is going to leave her house to them, if they want to continue living there, they will see.
The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundacin Realidad "We give them thanks for their loans and for continuing to lend to us. We hope we don't make a bad impression. We thank them very much because they are helping us to grow in our businesses."

loan.use: Buy sugar, boxes of soap, bleach, soft drinks, Sabritas chips, Bimbo bread, crackers, Barcel snacks, rice, beans, eggs, sugar, milk, toilet paper, purified water, and disposable plates, glasses, and spoons

loan.name: Bicentenario Dos Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Bicentenario dos, porque son muy patriotas y orgullosos de su pas. Esta ubicado en el estado de Mxico y es la segunda vez que piden un crdito. La Seora Nelly Uribe C. es integrante del grupo y la presidenta. Ella tiene 21 aos y dos hijos, ambos son nios, de 2 y 3 aos de edad, lleva dos aos con su negocio. El prestamo que solicita lo invertira en materias primas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y as tener variedad en sus productos, su intencion es crecer economicamente y tener una estabilidad para apoyar a su familia. La seora Nelly se siente feliz al solicitar este crdito ya que con l le podr ofrecer una carrera profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Bicentenario Dos, [Bicentennial Two] because they are very patriotic and proud of their country. It is located in the State of Mexico and this is the second time it has requested a loan.
Mrs. Nelly Uribe C. is a member and the president of the group. She is 21 years old and has two boys who are two and three years old. She has had her business for two years.
The loan will be utilized to buy raw materials to please her costumers and offer a variety of products. She wishes to grow economically and obtain stability to provide for her family. Mrs. Nelly is excited about requesting the loan because it may allow her to provide a career path for her children through schooling.

loan.use: To buy raw material

loan.name: Egon

texts.en:
Mr. Egon is 47 years old. He is married and has a 4-year-old daughter. His spouse is Ms. Margarita. She is 43 years old and she works in the house.
Mr. Egon says that he learned his father's work when he was little and thanks to him he can earn a name in a competitive market. Most of what Mr. Egon makes is home furniture, such as chairs and end tables. He also makes windows and doors.
Mr. Egon asked for the foundation's help to buy basic products for his business (cedar, pine and plywood) so he can get more work done for a restaurant. He thanks the foundation for the trust it has for him.

loan.use: To buy wood (cedar, pine and plywood) to make furniture

loan.name: Las Damas De La Colosio Group

texts.es: El Nombre de este grupo es Las Damas de la Colosio, en mencin a la colonia donde viven y por ser todas unas Respetables Damas, El Grupo se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Quintana Roo, Mxico y est conformado por 11 integrantes. La seora Francisca Acua C. es una de las integrantes del grupo, la seora tiene 46 aos de edad y estudio hasta la primaria, ella vende frutas y verduras, tiene 3 hijos; dos mujeres de 17 y 14 aos y un varn de 11 aos. Comenz su negocio de Frutas y verduras desde hace 3 aos, ella solicita el prstamo para surtir su negocio y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y as satisfacer sus necesidades, ya Q. es la nica recatera en la colonia, ella vende las frutas y verduras ms frescas y nutritivas. Con este prstamo la Seora Francisca espera ampliar su negocio y poder surtirse, y de las ganancias Q. generen poder apoyar a sus hijos para Q. terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Damas de la Colosio [The Ladies of the Colosio] in honor of their colony and because they are all well respected ladies. The group is from the Quintana Roo State in Mexico and is made up of 11 members. Mrs. Francisca Acuna C. is one of them. She is 46 years old and attended school until the end of elementary. She has three children, two girls who are 17 and 14 and a boy who is 11 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years.
She is requesting the loan to stock and enlarge her business, better serve her costumers and provide a necessary service since her produce retail store is the only one in the colony. She sells the most fresh and nutritious fruits and vegetables. She wants to be able to support her children and provide for their schooling.

loan.use: To stock her business up with fruits and vegetables

loan.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.en:
This committe was formed thanks to Ms. Catalina D., who lives in Villa Rica. Everyone was happy to form the Mujeres Rurales committee, naming it Mujeres Dinamicas (Dynamic Women).
The members of this committee are engaged in handicrafts, using the skills they inherited from their parents to make beautiful clothing such as shirts, tablecloths in aopoi fabric, etc. They are also engaged in trading food products, as well as other activities. With the foundation's help, the members of this committee were able to increase their income and improve their life conditions.
Mrs. Claudelina B. is a seamstress who for many years support her family by making traditional embroidery. She is skilled in crafts. She would like to arrange a loan to help her proviD. higher quality products by purchasing more threads and fabrics of different varieties.

loan.use: To purchase crafts supplies such as aopoi fabric, thread racks, etc.

loan.name: Policarpio

texts.es: Policarpio tiene 23 aos de edad es conviviente vive en casa propia con su esposa y su menor hija de 07 aos Policarpio en la actualidad cuenta con dos mototaxis en una el se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y la otra la da en alquiler,el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de una moto carga y asi poder ayudar a su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, se le propone el crdito por tener buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Policarpio is 23 and lives with his wife and young 7-year-old daughter in their own home. Policarpio currently has two motorcycle taxis. He uses one to offer a transportation service, and he rents out the other. This loan will be used for the purchase of a cargo bike, and to help his wife, who sells fruit. He has been approved for this loan because he has good references, and a desire and ability to repay it.

loan.use: the purchase of a cargo bike

loan.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Ms. Emilce Felicita A. D. P.. Everyone was delighted to be a part of Mujeres Emprendedoras, naming the committee "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn).
The members of the committee are engaged in handicrafts, skills which they inherit from their parents. They make beautiful clothing items such as shirts and aopoi fabric tablecloths. They also have various other businesses, like selling food and clothes. With the foundation's help, the members of this committee were able to increase their income and improve their life conditions.
Mrs. Emily has a profession sewing clothes and crafting ornaments. She has generated such good products that her clientele has grown, so she needs a loan to improve her products and proviD. the best to her customers.

loan.use: To purchase crafts supplies such as aopoi fabric, thread, racks, etc.

loan.name: Nazaria Yamileth

texts.es: La seora Nazaria Yamileth Garca R. tiene 24 aos de edad, vive en union Libre con el seor Emil Alberto Martinez quien se dedica pintar carros en su taller y Nazaria se dedica a la venta de productos varios tiene una tienda en la cual vende cuadros, flores, adornos para la cocina, sala y dormitorios tambien vende achineria como ganchos para el cabello, colitas para las nias, fantasia fina, Calcomanias, etc. el credito lo utilizara para compra de cuardenos, lapices, zapatos, pantalones, juguetes, tenis, borradores y papel. todos los productos son materiales para escuela, en estos momentos es temporada de inicios de clases y desea tener surtido su negocio. Nazaria tiene dos hijos y junto a el padre de sus hijos trabajan duro para salir adelante con ellos. Nazaria nos comento sentirse feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo rapido y esta teniendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Nazaria Yamileth Garca R. is 24 years old. She has a common law marriage with Mr. Emil Alberto Martinez, who paints cars in his workshop. Nazaria sells various products in a store she has. She sells pictures, flowers, kitchen, living room and bedroom decorative items, and items such as hair clips, hair band for girls, stickers, etc. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, shoes, pants, toys, tennis shoes, erasers and paper. All of these products are school supplies. It is back to school time right now and she wants to supply her business.
Nazaria has two children and with her children's father she works hard to get ahead with them. Nazaria told us that she feels happy since her business is growing and she is making good profits.

loan.use: To buy backpacks, notebooks, pencils, shoes, pants, toys, tennis shoes, erasers and paper.

loan.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es: La seora Gladys Mercedes P. S. se dedica a la venta de gaseosas ,golosinas,comida y otros en el kiosko de la Universidad Alas Peruanas hace dos aos aproximadamente , el cual es alquilado. Vive en casa familiar con su hija la cual es menor de edad y se encuentra en etapa escolar tiene otro hijo pero es independiente. Requiere del crdito para invertir en mercadera para su negocio ya que empieza a llegar la totalidad de alumnado y por tanto necesita abastecerse. Se le otorgar el crdito por que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales .
texts.en: Mrs.Gladys Mercedes P. S. has sold soft drinks, candies and food among other things in a rented kiosk at the Universidad Alas Peruanas for approximately two years. She lives in her family home with her daughter, who is a school aged minor. She has another son, but he is on his own. She requires the loan to invest in merchandise for her business since all of students are starting to come in and she needs to be supplied. She will be given the loan because she has good personal and professional references.

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Jose Noe

texts.es: Jos, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazn, tiene 35 aos de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 6 meses de edad, posee una tienda donde ofrece a los vecinos y amigos productos para el hogar, est negocio tiene 1 ao de existir, lo atiende de 6 de la maana a 7 de la noche; Jos quiere invertirle al negocio y para realizarlo solicita un prstamo que le brinde los recursos para abastecer el inventario. El prstamo ser utilizado en bebidas, arroz, frijoles, jabn y detergente, esta compra le ayudara para crecer con el negocio, cubrir la demanda y mejorar su condicin. Entre los sueos de Jos esta ver a su hija crecer sanamente, continuar trabajando con el negocio y seguir arreglando poco a poco la casa.
texts.en:
Jos resides in Corinto, within the department of Morazn. He is 35 years old, and lives with his wife and a 6-month old daughter. He has a store where he offers neighbors and friends products for the home. The business has been in existence for 1 year; he tends to it from 6 am until 7 pm. Jos would like to invest in the business, and requests a loan to have the resources to supply his inventory.
The loan would be used for beverages, rice, beans, soap and detergent. These purchases would help him to grow his business, as he would be able to meet demand and improve his situation. Joss dreams include seeing his daughter grow up healthy, continuing to work on his business and, little by little, making improvements to their home.

loan.use: To purchase beverages, rice, beans, soap and detergent.

loan.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Ms. Fabiola G. B.. They named the committee San Cayetano.
This group makes beautiful clothing items such as shirts and aopoi fabric tablecloths. In addition, some members of this committee also sell food products and clothing items to generate income. With the help given by the foundation, the members of this group were able to increase their earnings and improve their life conditions.
Ms. Fabiola is engaged in embroidery and needs a loan to move her business forward by purchasing the materials needed to do the work.

loan.use: To purchase crafts supplies such as aopoi fabric, thread, racks, etc.

loan.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal Tpac Amaru, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 60 aos de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos. Eusebia no pudo estudiar. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como chanchos y ganado ovino, en las diferentes ferias de la provincia. Viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce aos, su prstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, prstamo que le sirvi en la compra tres corderos. Con ste prstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que servir para comprar un toro y trabajar con engorde de ganado vacuno. Su sueo es mejorar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la alegra, el trabajo en grupo y muchos otros.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Tpac Amaru cooperative bank, located in the district and province of Tunguyo, in Puno. She is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children. Eusebia was not able to get an education. She dedicates herself to buying and selling small animals such as pigs and sheep at the various markets in the province.
She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for twelve years, starting with an initial loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she used this loan to buy three lambs. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, she will buy a bull and work toward fattening her cattle. Her dream is to improve her business.
What she enjoys most about working with the cooperative bank is the punctuality, the happiness, working with a group, and many other things.

loan.use: To purchase a bull.

loan.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Adrian Antonio C. M. tiene 21 aos de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa, cameras, toallas, ropa de nio, carteras y mas.
Adrian en las noches estudia en la universidad. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa escolar, este mes es de epoca en donde entran a los colegios y a las escuelas los nios y desea tener bien surtido su negocio para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes. su meta es crecer como microempresario y llegar a ser un empresario. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
The young Adrian Antonio C. M. is 21 years old, single, and dedicated to the sale of shoes, clothing, cameras, towels, childrens clothes, purses and more.
At night, Adrian studies at the university. He will use the loan to buy school clothes, as this month is the season when the children return to school. He wants to have a well-supplied store so that he can meet customer demand.
His goal is to grow as an entrepreneur and become a successful businessman. He needs income to meet some household expenses and to pay for his education.

loan.use: To purchase shirts, pants, socks, t-shirts, undergarments, skirts, and blouses.

loan.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista es socia del Banco Comunal Tpac Amaru, ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 aos D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 11 hijos. Evarista no tiene estudios. Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez aos, su primer prstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, este dinero lo invirti en la compra D. dos corderos para engordarlos. Su actividad econmica consiste en el engorD. D. ganado vacuno y ovino, trabajo que es realizado por ella y su esposo. Con este prstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprar un toro y su respectivo alimento para engorD.. Su sueo es trabajar con la misma actividad y mejorar sus ingresos. Est muy agradecida D. poder contar con los prstamos D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Evarista is a member of the Tpac Amaru cooperative bank, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and has 11 children. Evarista was not able to get an education.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for ten years. Her first loan was for 300.00 Peruvian soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of lambs to fatten. Her economic activity consists of raising cattle and sheep, a business she carries out with the help of her husband.
She will use this loan of 3,000.00 soles to buy a bull and its necessary feed. Her dreams are to continue with the same activity and to improve her income. She is very thankful to be able to count on the loans from Manuela Ramos.

loan.use: To purchase a bull and feed.

loan.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 25 aos vive con sus padres y su hijo en la propiedad de sus padres. Desde hace un ao y medio decidi abrir su propio negocio, meses atrs ella estaba apoyando a sus padres en las tareas agrcolas y con unos ahorros que dispona logr invertir en el negocio de su tienda que actualmente desempea en la casa de sus padres. La atencin que brinda es diaria y es la nica que atiende en su establecimiento aunque en algunas ocasiones la apoya su madre. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro con su negocio, una de ellas es tener una tienda ms grande y llena de mercadera. Es su cuarto crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita ya que le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra de ms productos y aprovechar la poca escolar que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Edith is 25 years old, and lives with her parents and son in her parents home. A year-and-a-half ago, she decided to open her own business. Before that, she was helping her parents with their farming tasks and, with some savings she had, she managed to open a store in their house.
She tends to her business every day, working alone but with periodic help from her mother. She has many future plans for her business, one of which is to expand the store and carry more merchandise.
This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to know that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated herself to be very responsible with her payments, and she also enjoys being part of her cooperative bank because the members are very responsible and united.
She thanks those people who may be part of granting this loan to her, as it will be very useful in growing her business. She will use the loan to buy more products, and take advantage of the school season that is approaching.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store, as well as school supplies.

loan.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen P. O., de 28 aos es la propietaria de la miscelnea y papelera. Variedades Margarita, ella vive con su cnyuge y su hijo de 10 aos al sur de Barranquilla, en una comunidad muy productiva de gente trabajadora, solidaria y de un gran espritu cvico,donde abundan microempresas en manos de mujeres. Karen inici su negocio hace un ao, como una actividad para entretenerse, pero al ver los buenos resultados le imprimi mayor empeo, y as fue dndole forma hasta convertirla hoy, en otra fuente de ingreso para su hogar y una manera de sentirse til y productiva. Su sueo es lograr ampliar su negocio con productos que tengan precios mdicos, donde pueda estandarizarlos simultaneamente en un solo precio que llame la atencin de sus clientes; camino a este propsito est aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo en la lnea de Kiva, para comprar artculos de cacharrera, baldes plsticos, tasas, tanques, termos y loncheras; inversin que proyecta ser exitosa por la gran capacidad de servicio de Karen y el potencial de clientes que tiene a su alrededor, de los cuales ya ha registrado encargos. Asi su asesor expresa que sus indices financieros se encuentran en los siguientes rangos: liquidez 2 veces, rentabilidad sobre las ventas entre 30 y 35%, endeudamiento actual 45%, rotacin de inventarios de 15 a 20 dias y que desde all proyecta su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en: Karen is 28 years old and owns a general store and stationery shop called "Variedades Margarita." She lives with her husband and 10-year-old son to the south of Barranquilla in a very productive community of hard-working, united people full of civic pride, where there are many small businesses run by women. Karen started her business a year ago as a way to entertain herself, but after seeing the good results she started putting in more effort and was able to convert it into what it is today: another source of income for her household and a way to feel useful and productive. Her dream is to expand her business with affordable products that she can standardize with a singular price to attract her customers' attention. It's for this reason she is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to buy crockery items, plastic buckets, cups, bottles, thermoses and lunch boxes, an investment she predicts to be successful in increasing her service capacity and bring in potential customers from the area, including those she has already attracted. Her adviser says her financial indices are in the following ranges: two times liquidity, return on sales between 30 and 35 percent, current debt 45 percent, and inventory turnover 15 to 20 days, which projects for future growth.

loan.use: Purchase crockery items, plastic buckets, cups, bottles, thermoses and lunch boxes

loan.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin Alberto Z. tiene 33 aos de edad y vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 12 aos, en el el municipio de Malambo a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; alli tiene un punto de venta de mercancias variadas, donde aprovecha para generar otros ingresos con la venta de minutos y recargas a celulares. Edwin incursion en la actividad comercial hace tres aos, como cobrador de terceros, y con sus ahorros logr emprender su miscelanea en la casa de su madre, donde vende variados articulos como perfumes, elementos de aseo y papelera en general. Anteriormente se dedic a la elctrnica pero no le fue muy bien porque las personas no reconocen esta actividad y todo se va descontinuando muy rapidamente. Por eso busc otra actividad que le generar ingresos y una vez emprendi su miscelanea, tambien adquiri 3 planes de celulares para vender minutos y simultaneamente de dedica a hacer domicilios de medicinas y a cobrar facturas de manera independiente, actividades que le permiten obtener ingresos complementarios a los que genera por cuenta de su miscelanea. Hace un ao le recomendaron la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, organzacin con la que recibi su primer financiamiento y adquiri 3 vitrinas que surti con ese mismo crdito. Este es su segundo financiamiento y con l espera incrementar sus ventas en un 35% , teniendo en cuenta que comprar tiles escolares porque es la temporada de ingreso a la escuela y justamente alrededor de su negocio existe un importante colegio y es parte de su mercado mas seguro. Su meta es aumentar la cobertura de clientes y lograr como todo buen padre una educacin de calidad para sus hijos, porque suea con verlos algun dia convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Edwin Alberto Z. is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 12. They live in the Malambo municipality, which is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. He has a business selling varied merchandise there. He takes advantage of the opportunity to generate other income by selling minutes and recharges for cell phones.
Edwin ventured in the business activity three years ago as a third party debt collector. With his savings he managed to undertake his convenience store in his mothers house. He sells various items like perfume, cleaning products, and general stationery items. Previously he worked with electronics, but it did not go very well for him because people do not know about electronics. Everything stopped very quickly.
That is why he looked for another business activity that would generate income for him. Once he undertook his store, he also got three cell phone plans to sell minutes. He also makes home deliveries of medications, and does independent invoice collection. These activities allow him to get complementary income in addition to what he gets from his store.
He was recommended to the Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo a year ago. He got his first loan from them, and he got three display cases that he stocked with the same loan. This is his second loan, and he hopes to increase his sales by 35%. He will buy school supplies because it is the season for school to start. There is an important school very close to his business, and that is the most secure part of his market.
His goal is to increase his customers, and, like all good fathers, give his children a quality education. He dreams of one day seeing them become successful professionals.

loan.use: To buy school supplies

loan.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana R. de 62 aos es una mujer muy fuerte y emprendedora, que con su negocio de fabricacin de productos alimenticios como deditos, empanaditas, arepas y pastelitos de queso, carne , o pollo, a los que imprime el sabor de la comida de su natal Cartagena, ha logrado sostener su hogar; Ana lleg de su tierra desde sus 7 aos a Barranquilla, ciudad capital, donde hizo estudios primarios, contrajo matrimonio, tuvo 8 hijos y finalmente se separ de su esposo e inici su propio negocio, que al principio fue la preparacin de fritos en su propia casa, actividad que cambi por la de panadera , con la que se posicion por muchos aos en el mercado y construy su legado familiar en este oficio, pues todos sus hijos en las edades de 25 a 38 aos tienen su propia microempresa en panadera, o en preparacin de productos derivados de la harina de trigo. Hoy su principal actividad es la fabricacin de deditos, pastelitos, empanaditas de queso, pollo o carne, los cuales distribuye en los colegios de los barrios aledaos a su vivienda y en tiendas donde es muy reconocida. Su meta principal es diversificar sus productos y la apertura de nuevos y permanentes mercados y este es justamente su gran desafo. En la actualidad est aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la lnea credikiva, ya que su capital de trabajo es muy pequeo y quiere fortalecerlo comprando, materias primas de contado para obtener descuentos por el volumen de compra, especialmente Harina de trigo, y azcar, que aumentan sus precios permanentemente. El negocio de Ana en este momento presenta una Rotacin de cuentas por cobrar de 1,3 das, una rotacin de inventarios de 5 das, mientras su rotacin de cuentas por pagar es de 2, 5 das y su endeudamiento con el nuevo credikiva es de 11,20%. Ana Isabel es una gran madre que ha apoyado siempre a sus hijos y en la actualidad ellos la poyan tambin, por eso su sueo es verlos realizados y con vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Ana R., age 62, is a very strong and enterprising woman. She makes food products like deditos (a type of fried snack); empanaditas (little turnovers); corn cakes; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies. She makes them with the flavor of food in her native Cartagena. She has managed to support her household.
Ana left her land and arrived in Barranquilla, the capital city, seven years ago. She attended elementary school, got married, and had eight children. She eventually separated from her husband and started her own business.
At the beginning she made fried food in her own house. She traded that activity for a bakery, which has been located in the market for many years. She built her family legacy through this occupation. All of her children, ages 25-38, have their own small bakery businesses or make products derived from wheat flour.
Now she primarily makes deditos; corn cakes; cheese, meat, or chicken empanaditas; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies. She distributes them to the schools in the neighborhoods surrounding her house. She also delivers to stores where she is very well-known.
Her main goal is to diversify her products and to open new and permanent markets. This is precisely her great challenge.
She is currently applying for her first loan from the Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo through Kiva. She has very little work capital, and she wants to strengthen it by purchasing raw materials for cash. She will do this to get volume discounts, especially for wheat flour and sugar. These prices are constantly rising.
Anas business now has a turnover on accounts receivable of 1.3 days, a 5 day turnover of inventory, and its turnover for accounts payable is 2.5 days. Her debt with the new Kiva loan is 11.2%.
Ana is a great mother who has always supported her children. Now, they support her as well. Therefore, her dream is to see them become successful and have their own homes.

loan.use: To buy a greater quantity of wheat flour and sugar

loan.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es: Jorge Eliecer E. vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la elaboracin y venta de peto, una deliciosa bebeida o chicha caliente, que se prepara con maiz pilado, azucar una pizca de sal y canela; esta actividad la inici para cambiar su antiguo negocio de fabricacin de un embutido costeo y muy artesanal llamado butifarra, al que se dedicaba anteriormente solo los fines de semanas, pero como Jorge Eliecer es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable de su familia, decidi adicionar otra actividad rentable que le generara ingresos todos los dias, asi es que conociendo el oficio de vender peto, en el cual trabaja su padre, decidi reemplazarlo para tener mayores ingresos, pues en su familia en la medida que crecen, aumenta las necesidades del hogar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 aos. Desde que inici en la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo con su primer financiamiento vio cambios positivos en su negocio, especialmente porque es un nuevo capital de trabajo que invierte y genera otras utilidades imprimiendole la fuerza de trabajo. El credikiva es su segundo financiamiento y con l cambiar el triciclO (vehiculo de tres ruedas) y los tanques de aluminio condicionando su infraestructura y adems comprar insumos para la elaboracion del producto. Su principal sueo es tener una casa propia para aumentar el bienestar de su famlia y por eso trabaja arduamente porque ellos son su inspiracin para hacerlo. En la actualidad su negocio presenta una rentabilidad sobre la venta del 22%, un endeudamiento futuro muy bajo lo que con su capacidad de trabajo y experiencia emprendedora haran que esta nueva inversion tenga xito, porque impactar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Jorge Eliecer E. lives in the city of Barranquilla. He makes and sells peto , a delicious drink, or warm chicha (a drink derived from corn). It is prepared with husked corn, sugar, a pinch of salt and cinnamon.
He started this activity in order to change from his old business of making handmade coastal sausages called butifarra. Previously he only worked on this on the week-ends. But, as Jorge Eliecer is a very hard-working and responsible family man, he decided to add another business activity that would generate income every day. That is how he got to know the job of selling peto, a business in which his father works. He decided to fill in for him in order to have greater earnings.
As his family grows, the household necessities increase. His home is made up of his wife and their two children, ages 9 and 15.
Since he started with his first loan with the Fundacin Mario Santo Domino, he has seen positive changes in his business. This is especially true because it is new working capital that he invests. It generates other benefits, leaving the imprint of the strength of his work.
The Kiva loan is his second loan. He will use it to change the triciclo (vehicle with three wheels) and the aluminum tanks. Doing so will improve the condition of his infrastructure. He will also buy supplies to make his product.
His main dream is to have his own house in order to increase his familys well-being. Therefore, he will work arduously because his family is his inspiration for doing so. His business currently generates a profit margin of 22% and will carry a very low future debt ratio. With his capacity for work and his entrepreneurial experience, this new investment will be successful because it will impact his income.

loan.use: He will change his tricycle and the aluminum tanks, which will improve the condition of his infrastructure for his new business. He will also buy supplies for making his product

loan.name: Eusebio Ricardo

texts.es: Eusebio G., un hombre de 60 aos y casado, lleg a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 11 aos, procedente del municipio de Ceret, lugar donde viva; el trabajaba en Cerromatoso, gran productor en Colombia de ferronquel, o aleacin de hierro y nquel, en el departamento de Crdoba, de donde hoy espera su pensin. Eusebio vive en el barrio 7 de Abril y es propietario de la Tienda los Abuelos, negocio que inici por recomendacin de su hermana y es hoy una fuente de ingreso y empleo para l y su esposa y por eso ambos son conocidos en el sector como los abuelos. Este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo y esta aplicando a su primer credikiva para comprar vveres productos no perecederos, arroz, aceite, harina y azcar en mayor proporcin, para ganar descuentos y continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia que es su fortaleza, lo que le augura xitos en su inversin. Desde que inici su historia crediticia en la Fundacin su negocio ha crecido, porque cada crdito es una adicin a su capital de trabajo que le permite expandirse al tener todos los productos que sus clientes requieren de manera asequible.
texts.en:
Euesbio G., 60 years old and married, moved to the city of Barranquilla, Colombia 11 years ago from the municipality of Cerete where he used to live. He used to work at Cerromatoso, a large producer of ferronickel - an alloy of iron and nickel - in the department of Cordoba; he is now waiting for his retirement pension from this company. Eusebio lives in the 7 de Abril neighborhood in Barranquilla, and he owns the "Tienda los Abuelos" (Grandparents' Store), a business that he began at his sister's suggestion. The store is now a source of income and employment for him and his wife, and because of this, both are known in the area as "the grandparents."
This is Eusbio's sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he is applying for his first Kiva credit to buy non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar, in bulk so that he can buy at a discount and continue offering excellent service, which will help him succeed in his investment. His business has grown since be began taking out credit with the Foundation, because each loan is an addition to his work capital that allows him to expand to have all the products that his customers need at an affordable price. Through this growth, the couple has been able to sustain their business well.

loan.use: Purchase of bulk non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar

loan.name: Gessler Stivenson

texts.es: Gessler Stivenson tiene 22 aos y se dedica a la venta de mercancias variadas como ropa y calzado, y tambien al comercio de joyas fabricadas en oro golfi brasilero y en plata. Gessler naci en un hogar Santandereano (Gentilicio de quien nace en el departamento de Santander) donde el negocio independiente y la gran capacidad de trabajo es parte de su cultura. En su experiencia familiar y desde muy nio tuvo todo su aprendizaje para emprender su propio negocio, sin descuidar sus estudios, por eso se gradu tambien como Tecnico de Laboratorio en la universidad, y desde all empez a comercializar joyas entre sus compaeros de estudio, profesores y empleados de la academia, apoyado por un capital de trabajo que le regalaron: su padre quien aport $200.000 cop , su tia adicin $200.000 cop mas y su madre, tambien prestataria de la Fundacin le dio. $200.000 cop, con los que complet su capital inicial. En la actualidad est solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, pues necesita un capital de trabajo adicional para lograr dar respuesta a pedidos que han hecho nuevos clientes y requiere ser oportuno. Con el comprar mercancia surtida como ropa femenina, joyas de plata y de oro golfi brasilero : pulseras, aretes, cadenas, tobilleras y anillos. Su sueo es tener una casa propia adecuada con un local donde exhibir toda la variedad de productos que vende, pues en la actualidad su gran desafio es la compertencia quien aborda el mercado con productos de menos calidad pero bien exhibidos y l debe hacer mayores esfuerzos para posicionar sus productos en el mercado. Actualmente su negocio presenta una razon corriente de 7,23, un endeudamiento total de 13,4% y con el nuevo credikiva ser de 28,45, mientras maneja unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 27 dias , su rotacin de inventarios es de 51 dias y su rotacion de cuentas por pagar son de 14,8 dias. Gessler es un jven muy capaz de salir adelante en todo lo que se proponga, asi que su emprendimiento muy probablemente generar en un futuro, no solo sus propios ingresos, sino tambien empleo para muchas personas y esto es con lo que Gessler realmente suea.
texts.en:
Gessler Stivenson is 22 years old and he sells various merchandise, such as clothes and shoes. He also sells jewelry made with Brazilian goldfill and silver. Gessler was born in a Santanderean home (people who are born in the Santander department), where independent business and a great work ethic are a part of his culture. In his family experience, and since he was very small, he learned everything to be able to have his own business, without neglecting his studies. That is why he also graduated as a laboratory technician from the university. It was there that he started to sell jewelry to his classmates, professors and school employees. He was helped by working capital that was given to him: his father gave her $200.000 COP, his aunt gave him another $200.000 COP and his mother, another borrower from the Fundacin, gave him $200.000 COP. With that, he had all his initial capital.
