Our member is a professional. She has been a teacher in a school where she has taught natural sciences for the past 4 years. In her free time she sells Yanbal products.
She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and the money from her loan will be used to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry. Her goal is to travel the world.

loan.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics

loan.name: Elisabet

texts.es:
La seora Elisabeth Hernndez Chaves, vive en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas Mxico, es casada con el seor Julio Gutirrez Mndez, en donde procreo cuatro hijos quienes ya estn casados y est muy feliz que hayan encontrado la felicidad.
El prstamo que ha estado solicitando lo invierte en la compra de frutas y legumbres, para luego salir a venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su pueblo, en esto lleva un ao y dice que le va bien ya que ha logrado ver que tiene buenos resultados.
Para dedicarse a esta actividad se puso de acuerdo con su esposo, para que juntos trabajen y as salgan adelante hasta que dios les preste vida.
De las ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad y de eso mismo toma para cubrir algunos gastos generados en su hogar, como tambin ser de manera puntual en sus pagos de fundacin.
Lo que desea es agrandar ms su negocio para que logre tener ms ingresos y as tener de donde sostenerse cuando ya est grande y no puedan trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Elisabeth Hernndez Chaves lives in Chicoasen in the state of Chiapas, Mxico. She is married to Julio Gutirrez Mndez. This marriage has produced 4 children who are already married and are glad to have found happiness.
The loan that she has requested will be invested in the purchase of fruits and vegetables that she will later sell in the communities near her town. She has had this business for a year, and says that it is going well as she is seeing good results.
In order to dedicate herself to this business, she made an agreement with her husband that they would work together and in this way continue to make progress as long as God grants them life.
From the earnings that she gets from this investment in her business she will cover some of the household expenses and also make her payments on time to the foundation.
What she wants is to expand her business so that she can have more income and in this way support herself when she is older and can no longer work as much.

loan.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to later sell in nearby communities

loan.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La seora Rosa Elvira Prez Hernndez, vive en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas Mxico, es casada y tiene dos hijos a su responsabilidad, quienes son: Kevin Jasiel de trece aos y la ms pequea es Martha Eunice de once aos de edad.
El prstamo que ha estado solicitando para invertir en la compra de mercanca para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva ocho aos y comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar.
Con esta actividad y inicio por el nimo de sus suegra ya que ella era la que tenia este tipo de negocio, pero luego decidi vender verduras y se lo dejo a su nuera para que se apoye con sus gastos de sus familia.
Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la compra de ms mercanca, para que se vea mejor surtida y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan comprar, y mejor sea su ganancia en su actividad.
Lo que desea es lograr ahorrar para que ha s logre aumentar ms su negocio, como tambin de eso mismo obtener para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que estn estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Prez Hernndez lives in Chicoasen in the state of Chiapas, Mxico. She is married and has 2 children in her care, who are: Kevin Jasiel, 13, and Martha Eunice, 11.
The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, which she has had for 8 years. She comments that the business is going very well, as it has provided a good income for her household.
Her mother-in-law, who had a grocery store, encouraged her to work in the business. Later, her mother-in-law decided to sell vegetables and left the business to Rosa so that she could help support her family.
With the earnings that she is getting she invests in the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can better stock her store and so her customers can find what they are looking to buy. In this way she can improve her profits. What she wants is to be able to save so that she can manage to expand her business, and so that she can provide for her two children, who are in school.

loan.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loan.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 32 aos es madre soltera, natural del distrito de Ayna San Francisco; es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a sus 02 queridos hijos Marisol de 17 aos y Liner de 14 aos de edad. Lo que ms desea en la vida es poder brindarles la mejor educacin a sus hijos. El lugar ms conocido y concurrido para comprar variedad de ropa es en un pequeo centro comercial llamado Gamarrita, es aqu donde Rayda tiene un puesto de venta. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesa, quienes visitan continuamente su puesto, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente de la ciudad de Lima. Lo que ms le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco. Lleva 04 aos realizando esta actividad y considera que lo ms difcil es tener que permanecer todo el da en su puesto de venta, ya que abre a las 08 de la maana y trabaja hasta aproximadamente las 09 de la noche. Con el transcurso del tiempo, desea poner un negocio ms grande, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su tercer crdito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crdito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy alegre y siempre esta poniendo las cuotas acordadas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprar ms ropa de la ciudad de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de prendas de vestir es la que tiene mayor demanda en la zona selvtica de nuestro querido Per.
texts.en:
Rayda, 32, is a single mother from Ayna San Francisco district; shes an unassuming, hard working woman living in a rented house with her two beloved children, Marisol, 17, and Liner, 14. What she most wants in life is to be able to provide her children a better education.
The best known and most popular place to buy assorted clothing is a small shopping center called Gamarrita which is where Rayda has a sales stand. She tends to all her customers who visit her stand here kindly and courteously thanks to the novel items she brings personally from the city of Lima.
What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers on which items look best on them because she entertains herself a bit doing so. Shes been in this line of work for four years and considers having to remain in her sales stand all day as the most difficult aspect of it because she opens at 8am and stays open until about 9pm. In time shed like to set up a larger business where she can provide better customer service.
This is her third loan with MFP and she knows that she must repay on time if she wants to be able to access future loans and is willing to do so. She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank who always contributes the agreed upon contributions.
She will use the requested three thousand new soles to buy more clothes in the city of Lima, preferably summer clothes, since this is the type of clothing most in demand in the jungle area of our beloved Peru

loan.use: To buy summer clothes.

loan.name: Mara Socorro

texts.es:
La Seora. Mara Gutama es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive en la comunidad de Hierba Buena que pertenece al a parroquia de Molleturo, este sector es de clima fri, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadera, son personas muy amables.
Doa Mara tiene 31 aos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 9 y 5 aos de edad y est embarazada de 8 meses por lo que est muy contenta, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos ltimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo labora como minero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
La Seora. Mara hace tres aos de dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y ropa, vende recorriendo la ciudad a sus amigas y conocidas, tambin se dedica a la cra de animales como: cerdos y cuyes.
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 3 aos y el dinero de su crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento de animales, cerdos y cuyes. Su meta es poner una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mara Gutama is a member of the Yanbal communal bank. She lives in the community of Hierba Buena which belongs to Molleturo parish. This is a cold weather sector whose residents are very kind people dedicated to farming and raising animals.
Mara is 31 years old, married and has three children who are 15, 9 and 5 years of age. She is 8 months pregnant which makes her very happy. Her oldest son is in high school and the rest are in elementary school. Her husband works as a miner. They do not have a house of their own; they live in a relatives house.
Mara has been selling Yanbal products for the last three years. She sells throughout the city visiting friends and acquaintances. She also raises farm animals like pigs and guinea pigs.
She has been in the communal bank for three years and will use the loan money to buy animal feed, pigs and guinea pigs. Her goal is to set up a store in her house.

loan.use: To buy animal feed, pigs and guinea pigs.

loan.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has his own metalworks shop in Ayacucho. He is also a mechanics professor. He will be using his loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase metal. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 7 years and was one of the original founders of his communal bank, "Solidaridad." He enjoys the weekly meetings, trainings and general support that FINCA provides. Pedro hopes to invest in more tools in the future and expand his business and increase profits.

loan.use: Purchase of metal for metal shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loan.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 24 aos, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Reside junto a sus padres en la parte rural del casero Cruceta en Tambogrande, una zona agrcola ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la regin del mismo nombre, a ms de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regin Lambayeque.
Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi propia. Desde hace tres aos, ha desarrollado una clientela ya conocida y establecida que transporta a travs la ruta Tambogrande-Cruceta.
Julio solicita un prstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para el mantenimiento de su vehculo y para la compra de algunos accesorios como unas llantas y un sistema de arrastre. Estas mejoras lo ayudarn a brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, realizar ms correos a zonas establecidas y as obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is 24 years old, single and doesnt have children. He lives with his parents in the rural area of Cruceta in Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in Piura province which is part of Piura region located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque regions capital.
He provides public transportation services in his own mototaxi. Hes been in business three years developing a set, established customer base that he transports on the Tambogrande-Cruceta route.
Julio is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan for vehicle maintenance and repair and to buy some accessories like tires and a traction system. These improvements will make it possible for him to provide better customer service, do more trips to established zones and thus earn higher income.

loan.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 32 aos de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatros hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del casero Palominos. Esta comunidad est ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrcola situada en la provincia de Piura, a ms de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regin Lambayeque.
Desde hace tres aos, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Cuenta con una vitrina y unos accesorios en su casa que usa para exhibir sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona como vende sus productos entre sus vecinos y amistades. En esta temporada, tiene ms pedidos por atender debido a la campaa de Mangos que trae ms gente a su casero.
Para satisfacer la aumentacin de la demanda de su clientela, Ana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ms mercadera con nuevos diseos. Por ello, ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is a mother living with her husband and four children in her own house in the rural section of Palominos. This community is located in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura province over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque regions capital.
She has been selling clothes for three years. She has a display case and some accessories at home she uses to exhibit her wares. She has an established customer base in the area since she sells her items among her neighbors and friends. During this season demand is higher because its mango season and this brings more people into her hamlet.
To meet increased customer demand, Ana wants to expand the business buying more merchandise with new designs. She has, therefore, thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

loan.use: To acquire more clothing.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy soft drinks.

loan.name: Juan Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Alfonso D. L. C. T. es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta que ha salido adelante con sacrificios al lado D. su esposa y sus hijos han sabido invertir en una tienda D. abarrotes que actualmente esta atendiendo su esposa Minerva mientras que el en su taller repara todo tipo D. lavadoras y refrigeradores, es conocido por mucha gente que lo frecuenta, en esta ocasin a ellos les esta haciendo falta el techo D. lado D. L. tienda en donD. tienen el taller D. reparacin y as poner L. losa para que puedan trabajar en tiempos lluviosos y fros y D. esta manera obtener mas ganancias, as como dar una mejor calidad a sus clientes, ya que abarca una parte del techo D. L. tienda D. abarrotes, y cuando llueve, ellos temen que se les pueda echar a perder algunos productos D. los que tienen para venta al publico.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alfonso D. L. C. T. is a very hard working, responsible, honest person who has gotten ahead thanks to sacrifices. AlongsiD. his wife and children they have known how to invest in a grocery store that his wife, Minerva, currently tends to while he works in his workshop repairing all kinds of washing machines and refrigerators. He is known by a lot of people who come to him.
They currently lack a roof on the store where they have the repair shop installed. He will install roofing tiles so that they can work during rainy and cold times thus obtaining more profits as well as proviD. a better quality to their customers since it includes part of the grocery stores roof and they fear when it rains some of the products they have on sale to the public could spoil.

loan.use: To install the roof.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Victor Alex

texts.es:
Vctor es soltero y tiene de 24 aos de edad. Reside en casa de sus padres en el casero Zaranda. Se ubica en el distrito de Pitipo, una zona agrcola situada en la regin Lambayeque, a ms de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Desde hace 1 ao, se dedica al cultivo y comercializacin de maz amarillo. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar este producto. Vende su producto a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Vctor cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres.
Vctor desea sembrar ms maz amarillo y comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Para poder asegurarse una buena produccin de su cultivo, ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles.
Vctor es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ser un empresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Victor is single and 24 years old. He lives in his parents house in Zaranda, located in Pitipo district, an agricultural zone in Lambayeque region over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.
For the last year he has been growing and selling yellow corn. He has a field where he plants this crop. He sells his products to merchants that visit the zone. Victor has an established customer base. Income from this activity makes it possible for him to pay his personal expenses and help out his parents.
Victor wants to plant more yellow corn and buy fertilizers and insecticides for his crops. To insure a good harvest he has deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.
Victor is quite a hard working man who is devoted to his family. His greatest wish is to become a successful businessman.

loan.use: To plant yellow corn and buy fertilizers.

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 51 aos de edad y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de la socia Alejandrina es la elaboracin y venta de panes Chuta, ella tiene su propio horno donde prepara panes Chutas. El PAN CHUTA es un tpico pan de la ciudad del cusco, caracterizado por ser un pan gigante que mide aproximadamente unos 30 x30 cm y 4 a 4 cm de grueso y por ser un pan muy delicioso, tanto as que muchos turistas gustan llevar una muestra a sus familiares como obsequio, a fin de que puedan estos saborear un poquito de la magia que envuelve a la ciudad imperial del cusco.
En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el prstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas ms.
Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 51, lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru. Her main activity is making and selling Chuta bread; she has her own oven where she makes Chutas. Chuta Bread is bread that is particular to the city of Cusco. It is characterized for being giant bread measuring approximately 30cm x 30cm and 4cm thick; it is quite delicious, so much so that tourists like to take samples of it as gifts to their relatives so that they too can taste a bit of the magic that enfolds the imperial city of Cusco.
Alejandrina requires a loan on this occasion to buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.
Alejandrina is a member of Asociacin Arariwas RICCHARIY PURIRISUN communal bank and shes grateful for the opportunity provided through this means. At the same time, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loan.use: To buy ingredients like flour and yeast and many other things.

loan.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
Juan Ral tiene 49 aos de edad y tiene cinco hijos, El naci en la ciudad de San Pablo de la provincia de Canchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Juan Raul vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de Juan Ral es bridar servicio de transporte en su propio taxi, el cubre la ruta que va de la ciudad de Oropesa a la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Juan Raul requiere el prstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.
Juan Raul pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan Ral, 49, has five children. He was born in the city of San Pablo in Canchis province, Cusco department. Currently, Juan Ral lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.
His main activity is providing transportation service in his own taxi; he covers the Oropesa-Cusco route. Juan Ral needs a loan for vehicle maintenance and repair on this occasion.
He belongs to Asociacin Arariwas RICCHARIY PURIRISUN communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means. At the same time he commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loan.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loan.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 45 aos de edad y tiene ocho hijos, Ella naci en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Guadalupe vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de Guadalupe es la elaboracin y venta de panes Chuta, ella como la mayora de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Guadalupe requiere el prstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas ms.
Guadalupe pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 45, has 8 children. She was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba province, Cusco department. Guadalupe currently lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.
Guadalupes main activity is baking Chuta bread. She, like most of the area residents who are in this business, has to lease an oven for hours to make their products. On this occasion, Guadalupe needs a loan to buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.
Guadalupe is a member of Asociacin Arariwas RICCHARIY PURIRISUN communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means. In addition, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loan.use: To buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 42 aos de edad y tiene tres hijos, Ella naci en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convencin del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Juana vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de Juana es venta de comestibles, ella tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Juana requiere el prstamo para comprar ms mercadera y as poder abastecer su pequea tienda.
Juana pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old and has three children. She was born in the city of Quillabamba in the Province of La Convencin, Department of Cusco. Juana currently lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru.

Her main business activity is selling groceries. She manages her own grocery store out of her home. Juana is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more merchandise so that her tiny store will be well-stocked.

Juana belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her grocery store

loan.name: Zhullin (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin est formado por 12 mujeres y un hombre quienes luchan en sus trabajos y en diferentes actividades diarias para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar a sus familias, son personas muy amables y carismticas. Viven por el sector de Zhullin o en sus alrededores, este sector se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica a la cra de animales y agricultura, mucha de su poblacin laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca y Azogues.
La Seora. Mara Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive por el cantn Caar, este es su primer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y ha fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este gran grupo de seoras luchadoras. Se dedica a trabajar como empleada domstica tres das a la semana de 8 de la maana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Doa Mara Mariana tiene 29 aos, vive en unin libre y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 4 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela del sector. Su esposo labora como ayudante de un bus, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. El dinero de su crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para iniciar en este negocio. Su sueo es tener su casa propia.
La Seora Blanca Marina Prez vive por el sector del Descanso va a la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 34 aos, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 17, 12, 10 aos y un bebe de 10 meses de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su hija de 12 aos estudia en una academia de belleza, su tercer hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector, con su esfuerzo ha logrado obtener una casita donada por la curia. Doa Blanca Marina trabaja hace 10 aos como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la maana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Hace 3 meses se ha dedicado a la cra de pollos. Es su primer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mam, el dinero de su crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para crecer ms en este negocio. Su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Zhullin community bank is made up of twelve women and one man who work hard in their jobs and different business activities so that they can offer their families a better life. They are very kind and charismatic people who live in the Zhullin neighborhood or surrounding areas. This neighborhood is characterized by the fact that its inhabitants work raising animals and farming crops. A lot of the population works in different businesses in the cities of Cuenca and Azogues.
Mara Mariana C. is a member of the Zhullin community bank. She lives in Caar canton and this is the first loan she has taken as a member of her community bank. She was invited to join this group of hard-working women by her sister.
Mara Mariana works as a cleaner three days a week, from 8.00am to 3.00pm. She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children aged 10, 8 and 4 months. Her eldest two children attend a local elementary school. Her husband works as an assistant on a bus. They do not own their own home but rent. Mara Mariana will invest her loan money in buying fruit to set herself up in a fruit selling business. Her dream is to own her own home.
Blanca Marina Prez lives in Descanso neighborhood, in the city of Azogues. She is 34 years old, is a single mother, and has 4 children aged 17, 12, 10 and 10 months. Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her 12 year-old daughter attends a beauty academy, her third child (a boy) is attending a local elementary school. Through a lot of hard work, Blanca has managed to obtain a small house, provided by the church.
Blanca Marina has been working as a cleaner for 10 years. She works from Monday to Friday, from 9.00am to 3.00pm. For the past 3 months, she has been raising chickens. This is the first loan she has requested through her community bank and she was invited to join by her mom. She will invest her loan money in buying chickens so that she can grow more in this business. Her goal is to get her children ahead in life.

loan.use: To buy fruit and chickens

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. Ella tiene 32 aos de edad y tiene dos hijos. Raquel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene un galpn en su domicilio donde aproximadamente tiene 500 cuyes. Ella vende la carne de los cuyes porque es muy suave y por supuesto que rico en protenas. Ya son seis aos que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Raquel en esta oportunidad requiere el prstamo para comprar ms cuyes y sueo es construir dos o tres galpones.
Raquel pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Raquel lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. She raises and sells small animals, such as guinea pigs. Raquel has a pen in her home where she keeps approximately 500 guinea pigs. She sells the guinea pig meat because it is very tender and rich in protein. Raquel has been in this business for six years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to acquire more guinea pigs. Her wish is to build two or three more pens.

Raquel belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Acquire more guinea pigs

loan.name: Dulce Deyanira

texts.es: La Sra. Dulce es una persona muy seria y respetuosa ella es casada, tiene un negocio de comida y venta de accesorios en su casa, en un futuro quiere ampliar su negocio si dios le da vida para de esta manera tener mayores ingresos por los servicio prestados ya que esto representa el nico sustento con el que cuenta por lo cual da con da se esfuerza cada vez mas para salir adelante.
texts.en: Sra. Dulce is a very serious and respectful person. She has a food business and also sells accessories from her home. In the future she wants to expand her business, God willing, so that she can generate more income for the services she provides. This is her only livelihood, so she strives each day to get ahead.

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 45 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. Su actividad econmica principal de socia Alejandrina es la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes, ella tiene 25 gallinas y unos cuantos cuyes para vender pero en esta oportunidad desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea el micro crdito para comprar gallinas, cuyes y alimento para los animales. Ya son veinte aos que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.
Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 45 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is raising and selling small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has 25 chickens and a few guinea pigs that are available for sale. Alejandrina is taking this opportunity to increase her business capital, so she is requesting a microloan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals. She has been in this business for twenty years and has done very well.

Alejandrina belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals

loan.name: Erasma

texts.es:
Erasma tiene 42 aos de edad y tiene seis hijos, ella naci en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de Erasma es la elaboracin y venta de panes Chuta, ella como la mayora de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Erasma requiere el prstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas ms.
Erasma pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Erasma is 42 years old and has six children. She was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is making and selling Chuta bread. Like most of the residents, she operates this type of business by renting an oven by the hour in order to make her products. Erasma is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can purchase supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Erasma belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other items

loan.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos es soltero y tiene de 28 aos de edad. Reside junto a su familia en el casero El Verde. Se ubica en el distrito de Pitipo, una zona agrcola situada en la regin Lambayeque, a ms de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Desde hace aos, se dedica al cultivo y comercializacin de cereales. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar este producto. Vende su producto a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Santos cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores.
Santos desea comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Para poder asegurarse una buena produccin de su cultivo, ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Santos es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old and single. He lives with his family in the village of El Verde, which is located in the District of Pitipo. This farming district lies in Lambayeque region and is more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos has been growing and selling grain for several years. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates this product, which he sells to traders who visit the area. Santos says that he already has an established customer base. The earnings he generates from his business are used to cover his expenses and support his parents and younger siblings.

Santos wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. In order to continue with the production of his crops, he is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos is a hardworking gentleman who is devoted to his family. He wants to improve his familys quality of life.

loan.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides for his crops

loan.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 34 aos de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. Su actividad econmica principal de socia Catalina es la crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, chanchos y cuyes, ella vende sus animales en la feria sabatina del mercado de San Jernimo ms conocido como Vino Canchon, ella en esta oportunidad desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea el micro crdito para comprar animales cros como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.
Catalina pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34 years old, has four children, and lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is raising and selling small animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She sells the animals at the Saturday fair held at the San Jernimo Market, which is better known as Vino Canchon. Catalina is taking this opportunity to increase her business capital, so she is requesting a microloan to buy animals to raise such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

Catalina belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs

loan.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene 41 aos de edad, tiene un hijo, naci y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de Violeta es la venta y compra de cerveza, ella tiene un pequeo depsito donde guarda y vende la cerveza, ella tiene abierto el depsito las 24 horas del da y vende todos los das de la semana. Ya son 7 aos que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Violeta requiere el prstamo para comprar ms cajas de cervezas.
Violeta pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and has one child. She was born and still lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is buying and selling beer. She has a small warehouse where she stores and sells the beer. Violeta keeps her warehouse open 24 hours a day and generates sales every day of the week. She has been in this business for seven years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her business. Violeta is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more cases of beer.

Violeta belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase cases of beer

loan.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 50 aos de edad y tiene seis hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. Cirila vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Cirila nos cuenta que desde muy nia sus padres le ensearon la elaboracin de panes y el negocio de la venta de panes de Chuta. Ahora Cirila es independiente y se dedica a la preparacin de los panes, ella como la mayora de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio de panes tienen que alquilar los horno por horas para elaborar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Cirila requiere el prstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas ms.
Cirila pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cirila is 50 years old and has six children, all of whom are independent. She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Cirila says that when she was a young girl, her parents taught her how to bake and now she has a business selling Chuta bread. Today she is independent and spends her time making bread. Like most of the residents, Cirila operates her business by renting an oven by the hour so that she can make her products. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Cirila belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other supplies

loan.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 20 aos de edad y pronto va ser mam pues est embarazada, ella naci en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Su principal actividad de Melissa es la elaboracin y venta de panes Chuta, ella como la mayora de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Melissa requiere el prstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas ms.
Melissa pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Melissa is 20 years old and will soon be a mother since she is pregnant. She was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is making and selling Chuta bread. Like most of the residents, she operates her business by renting an oven by the hour in order to make her products. Melissa is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Melissa belongs to the Communal Bank Ricchariy Puririsun which is part of Asociacin Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other supplies

loan.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jess tiene 22 aos de edad y pronto va ser pap pues su pareja est embarazada, l naci en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per.
Jess trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace un ao, l y su pareja tienen un pequeo negocio que consiste en la preparacin de panes Chuta. En esta oportunidad Jess requiere el prstamo para invertir en el negocio de elaboracin y venta panes pues su pareja Melissa desea comprar harina, azcar y otras cosas ms.
Jess pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jess is 22 years old and will soon be a dad, since his partner is expecting. He was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco province, Peru.
For the last year, Jess has worked at a private company--he and his partner have a small business making "Chuta" breads. Now Jess needs the loan to invest in the business of making and selling breads, since his partner Melissa wants to buy flour, sugar, and other items.
Jess belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" communal bank of Asociacin Arariwa, and he is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium. He promises to pay back the loan on schedule.

loan.use: To buy flour, sugar and other items

loan.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 27 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. Su actividad econmica principal de socia Marleny es trabajar como ayudante en el horno de una de sus vecinas, ella empieza su trabajo a las una de la madrugada y termina a las ocho de la maana del da siguiente pero las socia Marleny tambin se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Marleny requiere el prstamo para comprar ms animales como chanchos y cuyes.
Marleny pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marleny is 27 years old, has three children and lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She makes a living primarily working as an assistant in the bake shop of one of her neighbors. She works from 1 a.m. until 8 a.m. Marleny also makes a living raising small animals like guinea pigs and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy more of these animals. Marleny belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunities provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase small animals like guinea pigs and pigs

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. Ella tiene 42 aos de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Carmen trabaja en el horno panificadora Sota como ayudante del maestro panadero y su horario de trabajo es a partir de la una de la madrugada hasta las una de la tarde del da siguiente. Ya son dos aos que trabaja en el horno y le va muy bien. Carmen nos cuenta que tiene un pequeo negocio independiente que consiste en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas de doble pechuga pero necesita incrementar un poco ms el capital de negocio. En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el micro crdito para comprar ms gallinas.
Carmen pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Carmen lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. Carmen works at the "panificadora Sota" bake shop as an assistant to the master baker, and she works from 1 a.m. until 1 p.m. She has worked at the bakery for two years and it is going very well. Carmen tells us that she has an independent small business raising small animals like double-breasted chickens, but she needs to raise a little more capital for it. She is requesting the loan to buy more chickens. Carmen belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase more chickens

loan.name: Dejid

texts.en: Dejid, 41, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in their own house and her husband works a seasonal job. Her older daughter attends college and younger daughter goes to a local secondary school. She finished a vocational school in 2003 and started her own hair salon afterwards. She rents a room at a local market where it is mostly crowded. Her husband bought a mini-truck in 2006 and has used it to operate a transportation service business. He then started working as a driver for a mining company in 2009. Both her husband and she try hard to make a better life. Dejid is trying to expand her business and increase her income. She is a hardworking and active person who says, " We are paying attention to our daughters' education. We want them to get good education". She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy more equipment for her hair salon.

loan.use: To buy equipment for beauty salon

loan.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. El tiene 47 aos de edad y tiene un hijo. Victor se a vender panes Chutas a la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento del Puno. El nos cuenta que su hermana Marcelina es quien se encarga de elaborar los panes y el de distribuirlo. Victor y Marcelina hace 15 aos que se dedican a la panadera y a la panaderia le llamaron Virgen Estrella. En esta oportunidad Victor requiere el micro crdito para comprar materiales o insumos como por ejemplo harina y levadura para preparar ms panes.
Victor pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Victor lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. He is 47 years old and has a son. Victor sells bread in the city of Juliaca, department of Puno. He tells us that his sister Marcelina is who is in charge of making the bread and he is in charge of distribution. Victor and Marcelina have dedicated themselves to their bakery, "Virgen Estrella", for the past 15 years. Victor is requesting the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients, for example flour and yeast, so they can bake more breads. Victor belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociacin Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make his payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast, to bake more bread

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Per. Ella tiene 44 aos de edad y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. Marcelina se dedica a la panadera y elabora panes Chuta que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. Marcelina junto con su hermano Victor abrieron hace 15 aos la panadera Virgen Estrella. En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el micro crdito para comprar materiales o insumos como por ejemplo harina y levadura. Marcelina distribuye a revendedores de la ciudad del Cusco y tambin cuando hay tiempo lleva a la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno.
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal RICCHARIY PURIRISUN de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marcelina lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 44 years old and has three children, all grown up. Marcelina makes a living with her bakery, making the "Chuta" bread that is traditional in the cities of Oropesa and Cusco. Marcelina, along with her brother Victor, opened their bakery, "Virgen Estrella", about 15 years ago. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast. Marcelina distributes to vendors in Cusco and also, when she has time, in the city of Juliaca, department of Puno. Marcelina belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast.

loan.name: Gangantsetseg

texts.en: Gangantsetseg, 42, is widowed and lives with her daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a house and her daughter attends local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. Gangantsetseg began in the water pipe trading business at a local market in 2004 and has been operating for seven years continuously. She used to operate her business with her husband who passed away in 2008. Now her sister operates one of her stalls for 200,000 MNT monthly. Gangantsesteg's daily net income is 200,000 MNT and she pays 160,000 MNT for monthly rent of the stalls that she operates. She imports water pipes from Erlian, the closest border city of China, and spends 400,000 MNT for transportation fees. Her monthly gross income is between 700,000 to 1,000,000 MNT. Gangantsesteg is a modest and polite person who says, " I try to save money because I want to send my daughter abroad to get a very good education in the future". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to import water pipes or other items for her business.

loan.use: To import water pipes or other items for sale

loan.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
The four people shown in the photograph above are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. One of them, Kav C., age 42, has been selected by the other group members to be the leader.
Kav C. and his wife now have a fishing business in and around the Tunle Sap River. They have been fishing in the river for more than ten years. They earn a profit of $4 per day to contribute to supporting their three school-aged children, including school fees. Kav C. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so that he can catch more fish.
There are three other borrowers who have requested a loan as follows: Mr. Say L. will be using her loan to better support her fishing business. Mrs. Ry S. is applying for a loan to expand her grocery business. Mrs. S. S. will be using the Kiva loan to buy a new boat to replace a broken one.

loan.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements.

loan.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson B. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 50 years old. Gerson is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gerson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. He is also making and selling coco charcoal. Gerson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Gerson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gerson is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconut shells for charcoal. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gerson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional coconut shells for charcoal

loan.name: Yoeuk

texts.en: Yoeuk K. is 39 years old and married Chan Hun, 44, many years ago. She is from the province of Siem Reap. Through fishing, the couple is able to generate a small income of $5 USD each day which they use to feed their family. They have four school-aged children. They have a small fishing business in and around Tunle Sap River. Recently, this family cant catch as many fish as before because their boat is often broken. Therefore, Yoeuk K. is asking for a loan to buy a new boat.

loan.use: To purchase a new boat to replace a broken one.

loan.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie Q. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Genelie is married. To make a living, Genelie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Genelie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Genelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Genelie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Genelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional products for sale such as canned goods & beverages

loan.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard T. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 28 years old. Richard is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Richard owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Richard has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.
In 2011, Richard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Richard from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loan.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe M. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Buenafe is married. To make a living, Buenafe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. She is also operating a motorela or habal-habal with her husband as the driver. Buenafe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Buenafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenafe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Buenafe is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & biscuits. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Buenafe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional products for sale such as canned goods & biscuits

loan.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Alma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling homemade honey in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Alma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like sugar & pure honey. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make honey and other products

loan.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay R. is a 48-year-old resident of the province Kompong Tom. She was married but divorced her husband when her children were young. She has five children; four of them still live with her. The other one is married and lives away from the family home. To help support the family, three of her children are employed at different jobs. Svay R. plants rice and some vegetables to earn a living.
Svay R.s child is getting married soon but her current savings are insufficient to pay for the wedding ceremony preparations. To deal with this obstacle, Svay R. would like a loan from Kiva to add to her personal savings for her child's wedding. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy a few piglets to feed.

loan.use: To pay for her child's wedding ceremony and to buy a few piglets.

loan.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix J. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 59 years old. Felix is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felix owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Felix joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felix is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felix from HSPFI.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional bananas & coconuts for sale

loan.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, toothpaste and beverages in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods

loan.name: Em

texts.en: Em L., 30, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own farmland in Kompong Tom province. In addition, she raises a few pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Her husband is a cow seller. They have two single children who still live with them. Em L. is taking a loan to buy piglets to raise for selling.

loan.use: To buy piglets to raise for selling.

loan.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Amidst turmoil there can be found an inner peace. This is what Marjorie C., 32, seeks to prove in her life. She reached high school and is now an entrepreneur and mother to two children who are both in elementary school. Her husband, Ritchie, works as a cutter in a restaurant. Their family currently resides in Baseco, Manila.
Marjorie sells fresh fish to her community. She also sells fashion accessories to her friends, neighbors, and business acquaintances. Her four years of experience in these businesses give her the skill of knowing the tastes of her valued customers. These business efforts enable her to earn 6,200 PHP monthly.
To help continue operation of her businesses, she would like to request a 10,000 PHP loan. This money will truly help her grow her business as it will give her the capability to purchase more fish, as well as quality accessories for her customers. For Marjorie, this loan is one step toward improving and eventually expanding her business.
There are a lot of challenges surrounding Marjorie, so much that she considers her life in flux. The turmoil they have at home and with the rest of her family seems to rob her of the peace and focus she should be having in her business. She is also concerned with her husband, who just got in an accident. Adding to these burdens are the customers who run away from their debts. Still, despite all this, Marjorie strives to fix her eyes on God, the source of her inner peace. She prays for increased savings as her business becomes prosperous. She also never stops praying for a good life and a better future for her children. Marjorie also desires to have her own house and lot.
As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: To purchase fish and fashion accessories for retail sale

loan.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Applying what she has learned as a community partner in CCT*, Gloria O., 55, capitalizes on food as a basic human need to establish a business that will work. Gloria has finished college and is running a household with seven children along with her husband Nivarjo. From the province of Bohol, their family has come to reside in Baseco, Manila.
Gloria runs a peanut butter sandwich business. She personally makes the sandwiches and sells them to her neighbors. She also sells chicken meat in her stall in the President Aquino public market. She has been in these businesses for nine years now. She is able to earn around 10,000 PHP monthly.
To help her grow her business, Gloria has requested a 9,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to enhance her businesses by buying more quantities of bread and peanut butter, as well different kinds of meat to give her customers more options to choose from. She is sure that the loan will make her business more profitable.
One challenge Gloria faces is the difficulty her customers have when it comes to paying their debts. Sometimes she doesnt have many customers, resulting in low income. She is also overly concerned with her children whom she notices have become quite hardheaded. But she chooses rather to capitalize on these challenges and turn them into stepping-stones toward her dream of having a successfully growing business and a long, good life for everyone in her family. Gloria also desires to have her own house and lot.
As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loan.use: To purchase quantities of peanut butter and bread

loan.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Debt. Sickness. Lack. These are the things Nelsa M., 45, currently faces as a micro entrepreneur but which she refuses to give in to. Nelsa finished only high school, but she will definitely not pass that fate on to her three children, who are all in school. She presently resides with them in Baseco, Port Area, Manila.
Nelsa focuses on her sari-sari (variety) store located near their home. She has been selling products on a per-piece price to her neighbors for ten years. She carefully chooses which products are preferred by her regular customers over the others, and which items will easily catch the eye of potential buyers. Monthly, Nelsa earns around Php 6,000.
To help her grow her business, Nelsa is request a loan for Php 12,000. She knows that her learning in entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT* needs to be matched with sufficient money on hand to make her business grow. She plans to use this money to buy more products for her store, such as rice, sugar, canned goods, and charcoal. Indeed, the loan will benefit her business and eventually her family.
At present, Nelsas big challenge is her son's illness. Add to that her problems of dealing with customers who do not regularly pay their debts and low income at certain times of the month. Nevertheless, Nelsa is determined not to give in to these struggles. She focuses on eventually seeing the prosperity of her business and experiencing success in life. She hopes that unlike her, her children will finish their schooling. Nelsa also dreams of having her own car.
As a CCT community partner, Nelsa faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: To purchase goods for store

loan.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have a pig farm at home to help with the family income rather than counting on the husband's income alone. The problem is, most housewives do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To improve their capability, they joined in a group. In addition to exchanging information, they also get funds.
Ni Ketut S., 40 years old and a housewife, became chairman of the group Kerto Sato to enhance their capabilities in terms of raising pigs and raising capital for their businesses. Her share of the loan will be used to buy three pigs and the rest to buy feed. In a period of 5 months, pigs are ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loan.use: buy three pigs and feed for them

loan.name: Novie

texts.en:
Having come from the province of Masbate, Novie E., 55, dreams of a better life in Manila. Novie barely finished high school, but she definitely believes that there is more in store for her. She is married to Lindro, a security guard. They now live in Baseco, Manila.
Novie operates her own sari-sari (variety) store, and at the same time rents out karaoke machines to friends and acquaintances who are fond of incorporating music into their personal events. Novie has two employees who help her with the daily work of accommodating clients and maintaining the business. Monthly, she earns around Php11,000.
Determined to grow her business, Novie is requesting a Php 28, 000 loan. She aims to use this money to boost her sari-sari store business. She will buy sacks of rice and charcoal, which she will repackage for retail. She will also buy trays of eggs, canned goods, and diapers for babies, which she knows her community needs based on her ten years of experience in the business.
From the moment she arrived in Manila, Novie holds on to her dream of a peaceful and abundant life. One hindrance to this is the headache she receives from customers who do not pay. However, she gets hold of a way to solve this issue. She desires for an expansion of her business, and that implies not settling for anything less in terms of service and profit.
As a CCT community partner, Novie faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: To purchase products to sell in store

loan.name: So

texts.en: So P. is 59-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparent. So P. uses this farmland for growing rice crops, and she has been planting her crop in the dry-season rice field. Her husband assists her in the business. The couple is married and has four children, four of whom are single and still living under their care, while the other one is married. Two of their children are sewing workers in the garment factory. Because their farm is outside of a watering system, So P. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loan.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loan.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
This is Rubylyn G.. She is 33 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo G. and is the mother of a college-aged child. At this time, Rubylyn is working hard to be able to continue supporting her child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Rubylyn, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance that parents can leave to their children.
Rubylyn operates a ready-to-wear clothing business. She mainly offers new clothing designs like casual wear and tropical wear. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.
To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more varieties of clothing designs to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Rubylyn dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes that her business will continue to grow and be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To buy more varieties of clothing designs to sell

loan.name: Socorro

texts.en:
This is Socorro L.. She is 40 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Abraham L. and is the mother of a college-aged child and four other children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to continue supporting her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Socorro, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
Socorro operates a ready-to-wear clothing business. She mainly offers new clothing designs like casual wear and tropical wear. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.
To help her continue the operations of her business, Socorro is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more varieties of clothes designs to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Socorro dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes that her business will continue to grow and be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To buy more varieties clothes designs to sell

loan.name: Elbegsaihan

texts.en:
Elbegsaihan, 48, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His two older daughters attend college while the younger two daughters attend a local secondary school. His wife is unemployed and helps him with his business.
Elbegsaihan became a carpenter in 1984 and opened his carpentry business in 2001 after his family moved to the city from the countryside. He makes mostly woodcraft items and customized wood furniture, and sells his products at a local market. He supports his family's needs and pays his daughters' tuition fees with the income from this carpentry business.
Elbegsaihan is a modest and hardworking person who says, "our wish is to work hard and take care of our daughters' education". Elbegsaihan is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to buy timber and materials for his carpentry business.

loan.use: To buy timber and carpentry materials

loan.name: Enkhzaya
