loan.use: To invest capital in young animals in order to expand his business

loan.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyamis 58 years old and married. She has been working for the past year selling household products to the friends, relatives, and neighbors who make up her clientele. She is always working to gain an edge over her stiff competition and increase revenues. Hiyam now wanted to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua to procure more merchandise.

loan.use: To purchase more merchandise

loan.name: Obid

texts.en:
Obid is married with three children. He has a transportation business in his home town of Isfara, in northern Tajikistan. Obid offers transportation services all over the territory of Isfara. Hes known as a very careful and experienced driver, which is why he always has many clients. Obid started this business two years ago. Presently, his monthly income is about $450.
Obid is requesting a loan of 6,000 TJS to replace his minivan with a new one. This business is the main source of income for Obid. He works really hard for the well-being of his family. He has repaid all previous loans without any problems.
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loan.use: Purchasing a new minivan for his business

loan.name: Rakhatbek

texts.en:
Rakhatbek A. is the only bread-winner for his small family, which consist of an aged mother and younger sister. They live in Zhan-Bulak village and earn their living through breeding cattle. Rakhatbek started this business with the initial capital of 25,000 KGS and managed to earn about 2,000 KGS in a month. Today Rakhatbeks farm amounts to two cows, two bull-calves, fifteen goats and one horse. With the revenues from this activity, he was able to buy a plot of land.
In order to further develop the farm, Rakhatbek applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS. With the revenues, he plans to start building a house for his family.
About Bai-Tushum and Partners Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Sadat

texts.en:
Sadat is an enterprising mother looking to make a better future for the well being of her two children. That is the basis of her motivation to work every day cultivating crops like wheat, onions and watermelon. She tends to her business with great care and dedication. Her husband and son help her with the business. They sell their products at the local market.
Sadat is one of the better sellers, but what keeps her back is her limited product range. In order to sell more, she needs to grow more on her land. This is the reason why Sadat is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She expects that it will help her to increase her business, and above all it will give her the purchasing power to meet the needs of her family. Let's fund this self sacrificing mother's loan request and provide her a ray of hope.
More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loan.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loan.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda has been selling groceries for the last thirty-five years. She is a widow and has one son. This business provides the sole source of income for Mavjudas family. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. In addition to her marketing skills, she brings the qualities of efficiency and focused work to her business and seeks to offer affordable, quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her customers.
Today Mavjuda is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits, she plans to continue expanding her business.
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loan.use: To purchase additional inventory

loan.name: Hmayak

texts.en:
Hmayak T. is 30 years old. He lives with his parents and his wife in Lchashen village near Sevan. He has a general secondary education and for ten years he has been engaged in animal husbandry. With his family's assistance, Hmayak raises cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Due to the income from his farming, Hmayak has supported his familys needs, increased his numbers of livestock and bought a truck, which he uses for transporting fodder.
Hmayak is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his livestock.

loan.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loan.name: Stephan

texts.en:
Stephan M. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in school. Stephan has a welding workshop, which he has had for three years.
To help expand his business, Stephan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase welding materials for making beds and metallic doors for sale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stephan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Stephan hopes to further expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase welding materials for making beds and metallic doors

loan.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Three of his children are currently in school. Patrick has a small retail shop, which he has had for two years.
To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees and basic needs for his family. In the future, Patrick hopes to further expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase sugar and soap for resale

loan.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman P. is 36 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and his school-aged son. Arman is a biologist, but because of his living conditions, he has been operating a clothes trading business for about fifteen years. He sells only mens clothing in a rented place in the Vanadzor clothes market. He brings merchandise from Yerevan once a week and orders merchandise from China once a month as well. Armans wife helps him with the business, and so they are able to support their family and pay rent for their business location.
Arman needs a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a spring-season clothing assortment for his business. This is Armans 3rd loan from Nor Horizon; he has repaid previous loans without delay.

loan.use: To buy a spring-season clothing assortment for his business

loan.name: The Sulaiman Kpaka Group

texts.en:
These are some of the teachers of the Luke Memorial Primary School in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. The school was founded in September 2002 by the community to improve the educational standards of the children in the community. It is currently staffed with 8 teachers and has an enrollment of 373 students.
This is the first loan that teachers of this school have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. They are requesting a group loan of 4,800,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to buy or invest in something that they could not afford with their salaries.
Sulaiman K. is the leader of the group. He is 36 and married with five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Sulaiman was born in a place called Joi. He has been a teacher for eight years. With his share of this loan, Sulaiman will buy household items such as a fan, radio cassette recorder, a bed, etc.

loan.use: to buy household goods such as a fan, radio, and bed

loan.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma S. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. All of his children are currently in school. Juma has a boutique that sells clothes. He also has a second business, a poultry farm, which he has had for four years.
To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Juma hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees and basic needs for his family. In the future, Juma hopes to see his children prosper in life.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David S. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. His child is not currently in school. David has a small hardware shop, which he has had for two years.
To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hardware items for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for the family. In the future, David hopes to further expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase hardware items for resale

loan.name: Christopher Muya

texts.en:
Christopher Muya M. is 32 years old, single and a hardworking gentle man. He lives in Kangudo and has operated laboratory services at the same place for five years now. The monthly profit margin is KES. 15000.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy a modern microscope and some other laboratory equipment.
The anticipated profit he will save and invest. In future he desires to grow his business and own a clinic. Christopher is very hardworking, honest and patient with people.

loan.use: To buy modern microscope and other laboratory equipment

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 37 years old and married with two children. He has been working in furniture refinishing for the past 23 years. He is very driven to develop himself and his business, but because he is struggling to obtain enough capital to do this, he was interested in asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase an air compressor, a power saw, and varnish.

loan.use: To purchase an air compressor, power saw, and varnish

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy 10 bags of beans and maize

loan.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Peace and Unity group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Zainab K., 43 years old. She was born in Magburaka but currently resides in Makeni together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a prison officer and her children attend secondary school. For 11 years, Zainab has been selling toothpaste, soaps, toothbrushes, biscuits, milk, sardines, soft drinks, and other items. With her share of this loan, she will buy these items at wholesale to add to her business.

loan.use: to buy items at wholesale to add to her business

loan.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison A. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. One of his children is currently in school. Edison has a business selling charcoal, which he has had for 6 years.
To help expand his business, Edison has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Edison hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees and basic needs for his family. In the future, Edison hopes to further expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loan.name: Mugumya

texts.en: K. Mugumya is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not in school. K. has a small electrical shop, which he has had for 6 years. To help expand his business, K. has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electrical items for resale. With the help of the loan, K. hopes to generate greater profits to supply basic needs and food for his family. In the future, K. hopes to expand his business.

loan.use: To purchase more electrical items for resale

loan.name: Christ Roi Plus Group

texts.en:
Evelyne is the president of the community bank Christ Roi Plus, which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.
Evelyne sells soft drinks. She started her business in 1994 selling palm oil. With the profit generated and good management, she increased her working capital and extended her business by adding beverages and purified water. Evelyne decided to join one of Hope DRCs groups in order to achieve her dream of building a facility for storing soft drinks.
After joining the Christ Roi Plus group, Evelyne started selling mineral water which generates $82 of profit per week. The monthly income generated from her business and the six different loans she received from Hope have helped her to build up her working capital. Evelyne intends to use the next loan to increase her inventory by buying mineral water and some crates of beverages to resell at a profit. She is 42 years old and the mother of seven children whose ages are between 6 and 25 years old.

loan.use: to buy mineral water and beverages

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of his children are currently in school. David has a piggery, which he has had for two years.
To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of the loan, David hopes to generate greater profits and cover school fees and basic needs at home. In the future, David hopes to build rental houses.

loan.use: To purchase more pigs for resale

loan.name: Catherine Mwikali

texts.en:
For six years Catherine C. has been operating a salon and earns a monthly profit of KES.10, 000 in Machakos town. She is married to C. and they have three school going children.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan with which she plans to buy more weaves and cosmetics. The anticipated profit she will use to meet the family needs and pay school fees for her children.
In the future Catherine desire to really grow her business and own the best lady shop whereby she will be able to sell variety of cosmetics.

loan.use: to buy weaves and cosmetics

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Rose has a small retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize flour and sugar for resale. With the help of the loan, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase maize flour and sugar for resale

loan.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer L. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children. Four of her children are currently in school. Jennifer has a beauty and bridal salon, which she has had for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bridal clothes and braids for the hair for resale. With the help of this loan, Jennifer hopes to generate greater profits to cover school fees for her children and basic needs at home. In the future, Jennifer hopes to see her children prosper.

loan.use: To purchase bridal clothes and braids for the hair for resale

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph T. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of his children are currently in school. Joseph has a bar, which he has had for 2 years.
To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas and beer. With the help of this loan, Joseph hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Joseph hopes to complete his residential house.

loan.use: To purchase more sodas and beer

loan.name: Nyakahanga Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: N. John is the leader of the Nyakahanga Tukore Group, Ntungamo. He is 57 years old and married with 8 children. John has operated a business selling agricultural produce such as beans, maize and coffee for 5 years from his store in the Ngomba trading centre. He employs two people to help him in business. John is a determined and social person, traits which have won him more customers. He is able to make a weekly profit of 200,000 UGX. John says that before a friend introduced him to produce selling, he was only selling to traders from his farm. However, he now also knows how to make more money as he also buys from other farmers. He needs a loan to be able to buy more beans and coffee for restocking.

loan.use: to buy more beans and coffee

loan.name: La Source Group

texts.fr: Tulia Buloso Amani est entrepreneur, trsorire du groupe daffaire la Source, ge de 62 ans, marie, mre de 7 enfants. Ses fils ain et cadette sont respectivement gs de 42 ans et 26 ans. Son mari est un chauffeur. La cliente Tulia Buloso Amani est vendeuse des boissons sucres (Fanta, Coca). Elle vend ses produits son domicile. Elle dmarra son activit avec un fonds de 50$ reu de son mari. Il ya 2 ans quelle est en activit. Ce nouveau crdit doit lui servir de sapprovisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises (32 casiers de Fanta sucr et Coca).En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa vie en paix avec ses enfants et petits fils. La cliente Tulia Buloso Amani remercie Hekima pour ses actions ddies aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe la Source est constitu de 31 membres.
texts.en: Tulia Buloso Amani, a businesswoman and treasurer of the Source business group, is 62 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her oldest son and youngest daughter are 42 and 26 years old respectively. Her husband is a driver. Tulia Buloso Amani is a retailer of sweet drinks (Fanta and Coca-Cola). She sells her products at home. She began her business with a fund of $50 from her husband. She has been in this business for two years. This new loan should serve to supply her with new merchandise (32 cases of Fanta and Coca-Cola). In addition, she aims to enlarge her business and spend the rest of her life in peace with her children and grandchildren. Tulia Buloso Amani is thankful to Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) for its work dedicated to poor women who are excluded from the classical banking system. The Source group is made up of 31 members.

loan.use: To buy 32 cases of sweet Fanta and Coca-Cola

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Arc-En-Ciel Plus Group

texts.en:
Godet is the leader of the community bank named Arc-En-Ciel Plus ("Rainbow" in English), which consists of 14 members, who are jointly united for receiving loans from Kiva and HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.

Godet has been a microentrepreneur since 2008, selling shoes in the western part of Kinshasa. He joined one of Hopes groups in 2009 and the eight loans received from Hope have strengthened his business. He is planning to use the next loan to diversify his business and increase profit by adding more shoes to resell at profit. Currently, Godets business makes a weekly profit of about $120. He is ambitious and dreams someday to open a general shop. Godet is 37 years old and married, with no children. He likes his business because it has stabilized him financially.

loan.use: to purchase shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Bashir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. Bashir used to work at repairing bicycles. In 2007, he opened his own shop for repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He is well known and has a good reputation in his community.
Bashir is requesting a $2000 loan to extend the shop and install an external ceiling. He is aiming to expand and develop his work. This will help him to improve his quality of life.

loan.use: To extend the shop and install an external ceiling

loan.name: Maisha Plus Group

texts.en:
Albert O., aged 36, is the leader of the community bank named Maisha Plus, which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.

Albert started his business in 2000 selling miscellaneous items. He now operates a drugstore in the mid-eastern part of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of HOPE DRC, having already received seven different loans and repaid them properly. Albert intends to use the next loan to buy more medicine needed by his customers and to resell them to increase his profits. Albert's business brings in a weekly profit of $40. His ambition is to expand his business by opening a medical center. Albert has two children, 1 week old and 18 months old.

loan.use: to purchase medicine

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Kagongi Bakyara Twimukye Tukore-, Ntungamo Group

texts.en: K. Kellen is the leader of Kagongi Bakyara Twimukye Tukore-, Ntungamo. She is 48 years old and married with 8 children. Kellen has a retail shop in Mutojo that deals in general merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and so on. Her shop has been in existence for over 7 years. She is able to make 250,000/= as monthly profit from the shop. She also deals in the sale of matooke (plantains) from which she makes 90,000/= as weekly profit plus beans, groundnuts and so on. She is a very hard-working lady, very cooperative and flexible, and she aspires for business growth and a good-looking family. Most of the achievement that Kellen has got is the educational attainment for her family.

loan.use: Purchasing more stock for resale

loan.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta, tiene 46 aos de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Antonieta tiene un restaurante llamado Don Coco donde prepara almuerzo y extras, ella abre el local desde las 9 de la maana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Ya son 17 aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su trabajo. Ella requiere el prstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azcar, fideos y muchas cosas ms.
Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 46 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She has a restaurant called Don Coco where she prepares lunches and la carte dishes. Her business is open from 9am to 4pm. Antonieta has been in this business for seventeen years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items.

Antonieta belongs to the Communal Bank Yahuar Maqui, which is part of Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and other items

loan.name: Jorge Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas tiene 60 aos de edad, tiene nueve hijos y naci en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Leonidas es msico y toca la guitarra en su agrupacin musical, l tambin tiene un pequeo restaurante turstico en su domicilio. Ya son 20 aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Leonidas invertir el dinero del prstamo para comprar insumos para el restaurante y tambin para comprar instrumentos musicales. El sueo de Leonidas es triunfar como msico y construir otro restaurante.
Leonidas pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 60 years old, has nine children, and was born in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is a musician and plays his guitar as part of a musical group. Leonidas also manages a small tourist restaurant in his home. He has had this business for twenty years and has done very well. Leonidas will invest the money from this loan to buy supplies for his restaurant as well as acquire musical instruments. He dreams of succeeding as a musician and building another restaurant.

Leonidas belongs to the Communal Bank Yahuar Maqui, which is part of Asociacin Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase supplies for his restaurant & acquire musical instruments

loan.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 52 aos de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Leoncio es director de una agrupacin musical, l tambin tiene una pequea tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son 16 aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su trabajo. Leoncio invertir el dinero del prstamo para comprar mercadera para la tienda y tambin para comprar instrumentos musicales. El sueo de Leoncio es ser famoso con su agrupacin musical.
Leoncio pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonicio is 52 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is the director of a musical group and also manages a small grocery store in his home. Leonicio has had this business for sixteen years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. He will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise for his store as well as the acquisition of musical instruments. His dream is to become famous along with his musical group.

Leonicio belongs to the Communal Bank Yahuar Maqui, which is part of Asociacin Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise for his store & acquire musical instruments

loan.name: Maria Augusta

texts.es:
Mara Augusta, tiene 56 aos de edad, tiene siete hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Mara Augusta despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la confeccionar chompas de lana. Ya son varios aos que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien. Mara Augusta requiere el prstamo para comprar de materiales como por ejemplo lana.
Mara Augusta pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mara Augusta is 56 years old, has seven children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After completing her household chores, she spends her time weaving wool sweaters. Mara Augusta has been in this business for several years and has done very well. She is requesting a loan to buy materials, such as wool.

Mara Augusta belongs to the Communal Bank Yahuar Maqui, which is part of Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase wool

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He has been working as a driver in a local furniture company since 2000. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his children. He has obtained three Kiva loans and was an excellent client with punctual payments.
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his son's courses at the university. In that way, his son will have the opportunity to work in a proper company earning a good income, allowing him to help his father with family expenses.

loan.use: to pay for his son's courses at the university.

loan.name: Alipia

texts.es:
Alipia, tiene 45 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Alipia nos cuenta que se dedica a la confeccin de chompas tanto como para bebes, nios, damas y caballeros. Ella vende sus productos los das sbados y domingos en la plaza de Tpac Amaru del distrito de Wanchaq de la ciudad del cusco. Ella confecciona chompas de varn que cuestan segn el tipo de lana y la talla. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el prstamo para comprar madejas de lana.
Alipia pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alipia is 45 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She says that she makes sweaters for babies, children, women, and men. Alipia sells her products on Saturdays and Sundays at the Tpac Amaru Plaza in the District of Wanchaq in the city of Cusco. The mens sweaters she produces vary in price based on the size and the type of wool used. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy skeins of wool.

Alipia belongs to the Communal Bank Yahuar Maqui, which is part of Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loan.use: Purchase skeins of wool

loan.name: Gladys Veronica

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 33 aos de edad y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Gladys se dedica a brindar servicios de Internet y tambin vende celulares. Ya son varios aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el prstamo para comprar ms equipos de celulares.
Gladys pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladys is 33 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Gladys offers internet services and also sells cell phones. She has been in the business for many years and has been doing well. For such an opportunity she requires this loan to purchase more cellular equipment.
Gladys belongs to the communal bank, "Yahuar Maqui", of the Arariwa Association. She is thankful of the opportunity presented to her through this medium and as such, she commits to fulfilling her payments on time.

loan.use: To purchase more cellulars

loan.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is 55 years old and married with 3 children. She has been working for the past ten years at a grocery shop which serves her neighborhood and local community. She very much loves her work and is driven to further develop it so that she can support herself and her family. Sabahs last loan helped her procure more merchandise, and she wanted to seek another one from Al Majmoua to purchase more foodstuffs to sell at her store.

loan.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her store

loan.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino tiene 51 aos de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Su actividad econmica de Avelino es ser director de una agrupacin musical. Ya son 15 aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su trabajo. Avelino invertir el dinero del prstamo para comprar instrumentos musicales para la agrupacin. El sueo de Avelino es que la empresa musical se ha ms conocida y grande.
Avelino pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Avelino is 51 years old, has 1 child and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Avelino is the director of a musical group and has been in the business for 15 years. He is doing well in the business thanks to his dedication. Avelino would invest the money from the loan in musical instruments for the group. His dream is that the group will become bigger and well known.
Avelino is part of the communal bank, "Yahuar Maqui", of the Arariwa Association. He is thankful for the opportunity presented to him through this medium and because of it he commits to fulfilling all his payments in a timely manner.

loan.use: Purchase instruments

loan.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta, tiene 38 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Su actividad econmica de Maria Antonieta es compra y venta de carros de segundo uso, ella vende sus carros en la famosa feria sabatina del parque industrial. Ya son 8 aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su trabajo. Maria Antonieta invertir el dinero del prstamo para hacer mantenimientos de los carros que compr, ella desea comprar llantas. El sueo de Maria Antonieta es tener ms de cuatro carros para vender.
Maria Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is 38 years old, has 3 children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Maria Antonieta purchases and re-sells used automobiles as her form of income. She sells the automobiles on Saturdays during the famous fair held in the industrial park. She has been in the business for 8 years and has been doing well thanks to her dedication to her job. Maria Antonieta will invest the money from the loan to perform maintenance of the autos she purchases; she wants to purchase tires. Maria Antonieta's dream is to have more than 4 automobiles to sell.
Maria Antonieta belongs to the communal bank, "Yahuar Maqui", of the Arariwa Association. She is thankful for the opportunity presented to her through this medium and because of it, she commits to fulfilling her payments according to her time frame.

loan.use: Purchase tires

loan.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 40 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Gloria despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica atender su saln de belleza, ella tiene un pequeo saln de belleza donde realiza peinados, cortes, cambio de color de cabello y muchas cosas ms. Ya son 20 aos que se dedica a este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su trabajo. Gloria invertir el dinero del prstamo para comprar mas materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo champus, colorantes, tijeras y muchas cosas que necesita para el saln de belleza. El sueo de Gloria es comprar su casa y abrir un saln de belleza moderno.
Gloria pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 40, has three children and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing her housework, Gloria works in her beauty salon. She has a small beauty salon where she does hairstyling, haircuts, colour changes and many other things. She has done this work for 20 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into it. Gloria will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of more materials for her work, such as shampoos, dyes, scissors, and many other items that she needs for the beauty salon. Gloria's dream is to buy a house and open a modern beauty salon.
Gloria belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank and is grateful for the opportunities offered. She promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loan.use: to purchase more materials for her work, such as shampoos, dyes, scissors and many items

loan.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, tiene 47 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Orlando se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en su propio taxi, el sale a trabajar desde muy temprano o sea desde las 6 de la maana y se recoge a las 10 de la noche y trabaja todos los das. Orlando invertir el dinero del prstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.
Orlando pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Orlando is 47 years old and lives with his three children in the city of Cusco, Peru. Orlando provides a transport service with his own taxi. He works every day, leaving very early in the morning - from about 6am - and returning at 10pm. Orlando will use the loan to service his car and maintain it in good order.
Orlando belongs to the Yahuar Maqui communal bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided by the loan and promises to make all his payments on time.

loan.use: para hacer mantenimiento del carro.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty S. lives in the Makerere neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Betty has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Betty sells her product from home. Betty has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling water.
The main business challenge for Betty is transportation. She aspires to build rental rooms Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees and food.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loan.name: Tanios

texts.en: Tanios is 26 years old and single. He enjoys 9 years of experience working in an automotive repair shop. He is very reliable in his work and very energetically follows all the latest advances in the field. Tanios has found a way to stand out from his competition: he has learned how to integrate computer programming with automobile inspections. To this end, he would like to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a laptop.

loan.use: To purchase a laptop for work

loan.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Balbina, tiene 52 aos de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Balbina despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se va a trabajar a un restaurante como cocinera. Ella nos cuenta que uno de sus hijos trabaja en una orquesta llamada Laguna Azul y por lo tanto ella requiere el prstamo para comprar una guitarra para su hijo.
Balbina pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Balbina is 52 years old, has four children and lives in Cusco, Peru. In addition to taking care of her household chores Balbina works as a cook in a restaurant. She tells us that one of her children plays in an orchestra called "Laguna Azul" (blue lagoon) and therefore she needs a loan to buy him a guitar.
Balbina is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank and the Arariwa Association. She is very grateful for this opportunity and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loan.use: To buy a guitar for her son

loan.name: Carmen Lourdes

texts.es:
Carmen Lourdes, tiene 31 aos de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Carmen Lourdes despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a pintar artesana pero por campaa escolar se va a dedicar comprar y vender mochilas escolares. Carmen Lourdes requiere el prstamo para comprar mercadera como por ejemplo mochilas.
Carmen Lourdes pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Lourdes is 31 years old, has three children and lives in Cusco, Peru. In addition to taking care of her household chores Carmen Lourdes does artisan painting. But when the school years begins she buys and sells school knapsacks. She needs the loan to by merchandise such as knapsacks.
Carmen Lourdes is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank which is part of the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loan.use: To buy school-related merchandise such as knapsacks

loan.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.en:
Serge is the leader of a community bank named Bikamwa Plus. The group is composed of 15 small business entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their individual businesses.
Serge is 29 and single. He takes care of his younger brother. Serge runs a cell phone booth and is a money changer. Since 2006, he has been operating his business in the western part of Kinshasa. Serge works hard and makes a weekly profit of about 60 USD. His ambition is to diversify his business by adding beverages and becoming a beverage provider in his area.
Serge decided to join one of HOPEs groups in 2009 to expand his business. He will use his part of this loan to purchase dozens of prepaid phone cards to resell at profit. Serge has been successful by using good strategies to gain permanent customers.

loan.use: to buy prepaid phone cards

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Rejina

texts.es:
Rejina, tiene 26 aos de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Rejina tiene su propio carro y su esposo trabaja con el carro brindando servicio pblico en la ciudad del Cusco. Ella requiere el prstamo para ahorrar el dinero para luego abrir un taller mecnico.
Rejina pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rejina is 26 years old, has a son and lives in Cusco, Peru. She has her own automobile and her husband works with a public armoured car service in the city of Cusco. She needs the loan to save money so she can open an auto repair shop.
Rejina is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loan.use: To save money to open an auto repair shop

loan.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia, tiene 22 aos de edad, tiene una hija y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Cinthia y su esposo Abelardo tienen un taller de planchado y pintado de carros llamado Planchado y Pintura Ancashio. Ya son tres aos que se dedican a este negocio y le va muy bien. Cinthia requiere el prstamo para comprar un taladro. El anhelo de Cinthia es tener su taller bien implementado con maquinarias modernas.
Cinthia pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 22 years old, has a daughter and lives in Cusco, Peru. Cinthia and her husband Abelardo have an auto body and paint repair shop called "Planchado y Pintura Ancashio". They started their business three years ago and it has been very successful so far. Cinthia needs the loan to buy a drill. Her dream is to furnish her shop with all the latest tools and machinery.
Cinthia is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loan.use: To buy a drill

loan.name: Nyakashoga Tweyambe Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: T. Innocent is the leader of the Nyakashoga Tweyambe Group, Ntungamo. He is 28 years old and married, with three children aged 1, 4 and 6 years old. Innocent has operated a bar business in the Nyakashoga trading centre for 3 years. Because he is friendly, social and determined, Innocent is able to make a monthly profit of 150,000 UGX. He is also involved in the agriculture business and is a farmer just like the rest of his extended family. Innocent is hardworking and needs a loan to buy more beer and sodas for resale. Innocent hopes to be able to buy more land for agriculture, educate his children and expand his business.

loan.use: to buy more beer and sodas

loan.name: Paul Mutuku

texts.en:
Paul Mutuku M. is 50 years, married to Elizabeth and they have two children. Paul is a tire dealer and he has been in this business for 20 years in Kangundo, and earns a monthly profit margin of KES.20, 000.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fifth loan purposely to buy more stock of tire for sale. The anticipated profit from the proceeds of this loan will be saved and pay for his children's school.
In the future he hopes to grow his business, and open other tire shops in other centers.

loan.use: To buy more tires

loan.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina, tiene 23 aos de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Georgina despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar, ella trabaja en una pollera como ayudante de cocina. Ya son 5 meses que trabaja y le va muy bien. Georgina requiere el prstamo para uso personal, ella desea el dinero para la educacin de sus dos hijos Sharmely Flor y Julio. El anhelo de Georgina ver a sus hijos profesionales.
Georgina pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Georgina is 23 years old, has two children and lives in Cusco, Peru. After taking care of her household chores Georgina works as an assistant cook in a poulterer's shop. She has been working there five months and is doing very well. Georgina requires the loan for personal use. She needs money for the education of her two children, Sharmely Flor and Julio. Georgina's dream is to provide them with the opportunities for a professional career.
Georgina is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loan.use: To use toward the education of her children, Sharmely Flor and Julio

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 49 aos D. edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad D. Cusco, Per. Margarita despus D. realizar sus actividades del hogar, ella se dedica a tender su tienda D. abarrotes. Ya es un ao que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Margarita requiere el prstamo para comprar mercadera como por ejemplo arroz, azcar, fideos, aceites y muchas cosas ms.
Margarita pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui D. la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margarita is 49 years old. She has four children and lives in the city of Cuzco, Peru. After doing her housework, Margarita works in her convenience store. She has been working in this business for a year and it is going very well for her. Margarita needs the loan to buy merchandise. For example rice, sugar, noodles, and much more.
Margarita belongs to the Yahuar Maqui community bank, of the Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the chance offered in this way and she is also committed to making the payments according to the schedule.

loan.use: To buy merchandise. For exaple, rice, sugar, noodles, oil and much more.

loan.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 34 years old and married with 1 child. He has been selling gas canisters for the past 12 years. He very much loves his family and dreams of one day owning his own supermarket; for the moment, however, he doesnt quite have enough capital for that. Hasans last loan from Al Majmoua was very helpful and he would now like to ask for another to purchase more gas canisters.

loan.use: To purchase gas canisters

loan.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
Elisabeth, tiene 26 aos de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Elisabeth despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a tender su cafetn que est ubicado en la villa militar. Ya es un ao que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Elisabeth requiere el prstamo para comprar mercadera como por ejemplo un saco de arroz que cuesta aproximadamente S/. 141.00 nuevos soles.
Elisabeth pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 26 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After carrying out her household chores, Elisabeth works in her small caf which is located in Villa Militar. She has been in this business for one year and it is going very well. Elisabeth needs this loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, a sack of rice which costs approximately 141 Peruvian soles.
Elisabeth is a member of Asociacin Arariwa's Yahuar Maqui community bank. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loan.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, a sack of rice

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is from Lebanon. She started her own business in 2008. She sells different types of CDs and DVDs. She cooperates with her father to be able to meet the family's heavy living expenses.
Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase larger variety of CDs and DVDs to take this chance to increase her business sales. In the future, she hopes to further expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase larger quantity of CDs and DVDs

loan.name: Lisseth Melyssa

texts.es:
Lisseth, tiene 21 aos de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Elisabeth despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a vender artesana en la plaza de armas de la ciudad del Cusco de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cinco aos que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Lisseth requiere el prstamo para comprar mercadera como por ejemplo artesana de tipo platera. El sueo de Lisseth es tener una tienda propia y grande donde tenga una variedad de artesana.
Lisseth pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 21 years old. She has a son and lives in the city of Cuzco, Per. After doing her house work, Elisabeth works selling artisanal crafts in the Plaza de Armas in the city of Cuzco as a street vendor. She has had this business for five years now and it is going very well for her. Lisseth needs the loan to buy merchandise. For example, silver artisanal handicrafts. Lisseth's dream is to have her own large store where she can have a variety of artisanal handicrafts.
Lisseth belongs to the Yahuar Maqui community bank, of the Asociacin Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and committed to making the payments according to the schedule.

loan.use: To buy merchandise. For example, silver artisanal handicrafts.

loan.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana, tiene 53 aos de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Damiana despus de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a vender comida, ella tiene un pequeo restaurante pero el local es alquilado, ella tiene implementado el restaurante con las necesidades bsicas y la pueden encontrar desde las 12 del medio da hasta las 10 de la noche. Damiana requiere el prstamo para comprar una refrigeradora. El sueo de Damiana es tener una tienda propia y grande donde tenga una variedad de artesana.
Damiana pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Damiana is 53 years old, has four children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After carrying out her household chores, Damiana sells meals. She has a small restaurant which is located in rented premises. She has the restaurant equipped with all the basic necessities and you can find her there from 12.00pm to 10.00pm. Damiana needs this loan to buy a refrigerator. Her dream is to own a large store where she can sell a variety of handicrafts.
Damiana is a member of Asociacin Arariwa's Yahuar Maqui community bank. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and, as such, pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loan.use: To buy a refrigerator

loan.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 42 years old and married with 5 children. He has been working for the past 13 years in a mens clothing store. He is very much engaged in his work, perpetually seeking new apparel to showcase. Hussein is driven to provide a dignified life for his family. The last loan from Al Majmoua was very helpful in increasing the stores revenues; Hussein now wanted to seek another loan to purchase merchandise for the new season.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Sainte Catherine Plus Group

texts.en:
Germaine M. is the chairwoman of the "Ste Catherine Plus" community bank, which is made up of 11 micro-entrepreneurs united for the same goal of developing their businesses with loans received from Kiva through the IMF HOPE DRC.

Germaine A. M. runs a restaurant in the western suburban area of Kinshasa. She is 57 years old and the mother of nine children between the ages of 17 and 28, three of whom attend school. Germaine began her business in 2007 with capital of US $80. With hard work, able management and good customer service, Germaines business has prospered and has a permanent customer base. The business generates a weekly profit of $30. Germaine has already received and successfully repaid three loans from HOPE DRC. She is planning to use this new loan to expand her business by buying smoked and salted fish requested by her customers. Her ambition is to open a shop.

loan.use: to add smoked and salted fish for her customers

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, tiene 24 aos de edad, es soltera y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Rosalia es cheff y trabaja en seguro social de la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja en el rea de nutricin y se encarga de las dietas de los pacientes. Ella tiene un pasa tiempo que consiste en colecciona cosas tursticas, ella nos cuenta que con estas cosas ser para implementar el restaurante tursticas que piensa abrir. Ya son varios aos que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien. Rosalia requiere el prstamo para comprar de utensilillos y muchas cosas ms.
Rosalia pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 24 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Rosalia is a chef and works in the Social Security offices, in the city of Cusco. She works in the nutrition field and is in charge of the patients' diets. Rosalia's hobby is collecting tourist items. She tells us that she plans to use these items in the tourist restaurant that she is planning to open. She has been in this business for several years and it is going well. Rosalia needs this loan to buy utensils and many other items.
Rosalia is a member of Asociacin Arariwa's Yahuar Maqui community bank. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and, as such, pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loan.use: To equip the tourist restaurant that she plans to open

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel, tiene 25 aos de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Raquel se dedica a preparar tortas y vende y distribuye a tiendas, pasteleras y otros. Ella tiene un pequeo taller en su domicilio donde prepara las tortas. Ella requiere el prstamo para comprar mas insumos como por ejemplo harina, azcar, mantequilla, huevos y muchas cosas ms.
Raquel pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Raquel is 25 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She makes cakes which she sells and distributes to stores, cake shops and other establishments. She has a small workshop in her home where she prepares the cakes. Raquel needs this loan to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, eggs and many other products.
Raquel is a member of Asociacin Arariwa's Yahuar Maqui community bank. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and, as such, pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loan.use: To buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, eggs and many other products

loan.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome, tiene 20 aos de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Per. Salome se dedica a tender a su hijo pero ahora ella quiere hacer un pequeo negocio que consistir en vender ropa de forma ambulatoria, ella es socia nueva en el banco comunal pues su vecina Antonieta la invito a participar. Ella requiere el prstamo para comprar mercadera como por ejemplo chompas, polos, pantalones y muchas cosas ms.
Salome pertenece al banco comunal Yahuar Maqui de la Asociacin Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Salome is 20 years old, has one child, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Salome looks after her child but she would like to have a small business selling clothes door to door. She is a new member of her community bank and it was her neighbor Antonieta who invited her to become a member. Salome needs this loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters, tops, pants and many other products.
Salome is a member of Asociacin Arariwa's Yahuar Maqui community bank. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and, as such, pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loan.use: To buy merchandise such as sweaters, tops, pants and many other products

loan.name: Akob

texts.en: Akob is 60 years old and married with one child. He has been working as a sewing professional for the past 26 years. His only concern in life is his work and his family, for whom he strives to provide a decent life. Akob is very proactive in building his business. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Akob was interested in obtaining another loan to purchase a loom, yarn, and other materials.

loan.use: To purchase a loom, yarn and other materials

loan.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 36-year-old married man, blessed with three children. He practices horticultural farming so as to earn a living. He was previously practicing dairy farming. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to get loans which have enabled him to purchase farm inputs. He hopes to enlarge his business in five years and buy a pick-up to supply farm produce. With 65,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy a motorbike.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike

loan.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia S. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters children). Lukia has a business selling old clothes. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 6 days out of every week.
Lukia sells her products in a shop. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She also generates additional income through selling water and through rental rooms
The main business challenges for Lukia are seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to one day build a house. Lukia lives in a home that she rents and has access to electricity.

loan.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loan.name: Eulalia

texts.es: La seora Eulalia se dedica a la venta de Caf, con el dinero del prstamo adquirir mayor cantidad de Insumos para la elaboracin y comercializacin de caf. Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutencin, por eso que esta solicitando el prstamo para comprar la mercanca que necesita.
texts.en: Eulalia sells coffee. With the money from the loan, she will purchase supplies for the production and the marketing of coffee. She lives in her own house which is located in the Alto San Pedro area in the city of La Paz. This is her primary source of income for supporting herself. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy the merchandise she needs.

loan.use: to purchase supplies for the production and the marketing of coffee

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. lives in the Kisasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of four orphans.
Gladys has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gladys sells products in her beauty shop.
Gladys has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and cosmetics. She also generates additional income through dealing in rental houses.The main business challenge for Gladys is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to achieve her long-term needs. Gladys lives in a home that she rents. She does not have access to electricity or to piped water.

loan.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, weaves, cream relaxers and braids

loan.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two grown children. She sells bed linens and sheets as well as blankets in the central marketplace of her hometown of Novomoskovsk. Yelena owns a big vending facility in this market, which is located in a busy spot where hundreds of potential customers pass by every day. She has been in this business for three years. Her monthly gross income is 35,000 UAH; the profit amounts to 6,000 UAH per month.
Yelena is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase the assorted merchandise she offers for sale. She believes financial assistance will help her grow her business and generate additional income as a result. Yelena's grandson has leukemia and needs expensive medication. Yelena invests a portion of her profit in the medical treatment of her little grandson. She is a great optimist and tries to look on the bright side of life.

loan.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loan.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 38-year-old designer. She designs clothes so as to earn a living. Being a single mother of two, she works hard to provide for her children. Roselyne also runs other businesses such as hair-dressing so as to supplement her income. She was previously doing catering.
Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has really grown. She dreams of opening a fashion design school in the future. She will use the loan of 60,000 Kes to buy a stand for a sewing machine and fabric.

loan.use: buy a stand for a sewing machine and fabric

loan.name: Lavodi Plus Group

texts.en:
M. is the leader of the Community Bank named Lavodi Plus. It is composed of 12 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
M. is 40 years old and the father of five children whose ages vary between 1 and 12 years old. Three of them go to school. He has been active in his business since 1999. He sells mattresses in the western area of Kinshasa. He has already taken out three loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. Thanks to Hopes loans, his business has prospered and it generates a profit of $100 per week.
M. intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of his business by buying some more mattresses to resell at a profit and increase his income. His ambition is to diversify his business and become a provider in his environment. He works hard in order to achieve his dream.

loan.use: increasing his stock by buying some fresh foods and reselling them at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Blanca

texts.es: La seora Blanca con el dinero del prstamo cancelar las mensualidades escolares de su hijo; Blanca seora es profesora, Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutencin; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Norte de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crdito a travs de Kiva.
texts.en: Blanca will use her loan money to pay her son's monthly school fees. Blanca is a teacher. This is her main source of income for supporting herself and her family. She lives in her own home which is located in the north of the city of La Paz. This is the second time that she has requested a Kiva loan.

loan.use: To pay this year's school fees for her son

loan.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, de 65 aos, es un padre muy amoroso de un carcter noble. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores y que son ya independientes. Despus de trabajar como chofer para otras personas, pens en comprarse su propio carro y lo logr. Por ello, en la actualidad trabaja arduamente desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, y slo as pudo educar a sus hijos; que ahora son hombres de bien, por lo que siente mucha felicidad. En esta actividad tiene ms de 15 aos, dos de ellos trabaja con su carro propio afiliado a la asociacin metropolitana de taxis de la municipalidad de Lima, y eso le da confianza a los transentes de optar de sus servicios. Es por ello que este hacendoso hombre est convencido que trabajando arduamente y la ayuda de ustedes l podr terminar de pagar las cuotas de su carro, y despus dedicarse a realizar alguna mejoras en su casa. Es el 13avo crdito que tiene con MFP, donde es un asiduo e incansable trabajador, por ello dice que con confen en l y estn seguros que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Por ello con el crdito que solicita, pagar parte de su cuota y tambin comprar dos llantas, para el repuesto de su carro.
texts.en: Augusto is 65 years old. He is a very loving father with a noble character. He lives in his own house with his wife and two older, independent children. After working as a chauffeur for other people, Augusto thought about buying his own car and then he did. He has worked very hard from the early morning until late at night. With his hard work, he was able to educate his children. Now they are good men and he is very happy. He has worked in this business for more than 15 years. For two of them, he has worked with his own car as a member of the metropolitan taxi association in the city of Lima. This gives his passengers the confidence to use his services. This hardworking man is convinced that with hard work and your help he can finish making his car payments and then he can focus on making improvements to his house. This is his 13th loan with MFP and he is a regular and hard worker. For this reason, he says to trust in him and to know that he will make all of his payments on time. With the loan requested, he will pay part of his car payment and he will also buy two spare tires for his car.

loan.use: to buy two spare tires

loan.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a member of "Umoja Wetu" group in Faulu Kenya. He owns a pick-up which he uses for transport business. He has been running the business for eight years and has employed three people. He also operates an electronic shop for more income. He was previously employed and opted to go into business so as to earn better income.
Evans has witnessed financial growth since he joined Faulu Kenya. He hopes to buy more vehicles for transport in five years. He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy tires for his pick-up.

loan.use: To buy tires for his pick-up

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. He owns a small shop where he has been selling medical supplies for 15 years. Despite his older age, he has to work hard in cooperation with his family members to reach a good financial levE.. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client.
Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business and purchase additional equipment and supplies so he can increase his business sales and therefore his income.

loan.use: to improve his business and purchase additional equipment and supplies

loan.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, es un hombre carismtico, de 58 aos, viudo y padre de 3 hijos que son independientes. Vive en casa de su hermano. Desde muy joven Marino ha trabajado en diversos oficios, y desde que falleci su esposa y sus hijos se independizaron se ha sentido muy solo. Es as como su hermano le ofreci trabajar en su cuadrilla de estibador. Desde entocnes diario madrugan y trabajan con su hermano, para descargar los camiones con cargas de azcar y arroz, ya que para las 7 8 de la maana, hayan logrado descargar hasta dos carros. De este modo lleva su vida Marino, ms tranquilo y seguro de lo que quiere para su futuro. Por ello, esta pensando en construir su propio cuarto en el terreno que le brinda su hermano y, de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. A l le han reincorporado a un grupo pequeo, por lo que es su primer crdito con MFP, y dice que con confen en l y estn seguros que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea seguir trabajando para progresar. Y, con el crdito que solicita, comprar cemento y arena, para que l mismo construya su cuarto, ya que tambin conoce mucho de albailera.
texts.en:
Marino is a charismatic 58 year-old man. He is a widower and father to three children who now live independently. Marino lives in his brother's home.
Marino has worked in a number of trades from a very young age. Since his wife died and his children grew up he has felt very lonely so his brother offered him work in his team working as a docker. Marino gets up very early in the morning and works with his brother, unloading trucks with cargos of sugar and rice. By 7 or 8 in the morning they have managed to unload up to two cars. This is how Marino leads his life but it is quieter and safer than he would like for his future. For this reason, he is planning to build his own room on a plot of land that his brother has offered him in order to improve his quality of life.
Marino has been reincorporated into a small group for his first loan with MFP and he says that they trust him and are certain that he will make all his loan repayments on time since he would like to continue working in order to make progress. Marino will use the loan money to buy cement and sand so that he himself can build his room since he knows a lot about building work.

loan.use: To buy cement and sand

loan.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 23 years old and sells clothes at local fairs/markets. She always travels to Lima to buy her merchandise which she sells in Ayacucho. Nelida will use her next loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy more clothes in order to increase her capital. Nelida has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. With her previous loan she was able to buy the material needed to set up her fair stand and to increase her business.
Being a member of FINCA also provides her with the opportunity to study education at the local university. She enjoys the opportunity of saving and the training sessions provided have inspired her. She has learned to value herself more and to be responsible. Her goal is to open up her own clothing store.

loan.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loan.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy requiere el crdito para comprar herramientas de trabajo, como medidores de corriente, mquina soldadora, guantes de seguridad; Fredy es empleado y es tcnico electricista. Con el ingreso que obtiene Fredy mantiene su hijo y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la zona Villa Nueva Potos de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene un hijo. Es el primer crdito que tiene con IMPRO y con KIVA.
texts.en: Fredy needs this loan to buy work tools such as a current meter, a soldering iron and safety gloves. Fredy is an employee and he is an electrician. Fredy uses his income to support his son. He lives in his parents' home which is located in the Villa Nueva Potos district of the city of La Paz. This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loan.use: To buy a current meter, soldering iron and safety gloves so that he can continue in his business as an electrician

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: The purchase of manure for use on his farms

loan.name: Boboto Plus Group

texts.en:
Rgine is the leader of a community bank named Boboto Plus, made up of eleven members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution, HOPE DRC, in order to develop their businesses.
Rgine sells shikwanges (a kind of bread made of manioc flour), which are Kinshasas main food. She also sells onions and miscellaneous other foods. She sells at a market located in the northeastern part of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1982. She has taken out 12 loans from HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them.
With her next loan, Rgine will be able to meet the customers' demands and generate additional profits. Her business makes approximately $50 of profit per week. One of Rgines strategies to keep her clients is that she tells them in advance about any change that can occur in her business.
Her ambition is to diversify her business by opening a beverage facility in her area. Rgine is 45 years old, married, and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 26. Three of them attend school.

loan.use: to increase her inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and the father of two children, ages 5 and 1. He does dairy farming to earn his daily bread. Besides, he is also otherwise employed. He joined Faulu Kenya under a group where he saves his money. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances. He hopes to add five more cows to his farm in the future.
He has requested 30,000 KES to buy animal feed and a sprayer.

loan.use: To buy animal feed and a sprayer

loan.name: Bisiriyu Oyeramiyi

texts.fr: Monsieur Bisiriyu a 48 ans et mari. Il a habite Ago. Pour rpondre aux besoins de ces enfants, il fait la vente de matriaux lectrique. Il achte les matriaux au grand march de Lom et revend dans une boutique non loin de super march Leader Price Ago. Il a commenc en 1992 lactivit. Il sollicite un prt pour acheter 2 douzaines dampoule rglette, 2 douzaines dampoule conomique, 3 rouleaux de cble VGV et 5 cartons de botes ronde.
