texts.en: Mr. Bisiriyu is 48 years old and married. He lives in Ago. In order to meet the needs of his children, he runs a business selling electrical equipment. He buys his goods at the grand market in Lom and re-sells them at a store not far from the Leader Price supermarket in Ago. He begin this business in 1992. He is seeking a loan to buy 2 dozen track light bulbs, 2 dozen energy-saving bulbs, 3 rolls of VGV cable, and 5 boxes of round tins.

loan.use: To buy electrical supplies

loan.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two teenage children. He lives in Vodyanoye, Ukraine, and grows early spring vegetables to sell in the local markets in his region. He owns six arch greenhouses where he does tomato and radish farming. He has been in the business for nine years. He currently has 90,000 UAH invested in his business. Annually, he spends about 45,000 UAH on seeds and polyethylene protective film.
He is requesting a 15,000 UAH loan to buy five rolls of polyethylene film to repair the greenhouses damaged during the heavy winter snowfalls and ice. The loan will give him a chance to sow seedlings in his greenhouses on time.
Vitalyis daughter is graduating from high school and would like to enter a university. Vitalyi hopes to earn enough money selling groceries this summer to pay for her first year of studies.

loan.use: to buy polyethylene to repair his greenhouses

loan.name: Eric

texts.es: Eric es empleado en una empresa grafica como operador de mquina Offset, el crdito lo requiere para la compra de material de impresin (tinta, papel, etc.) para no perder un cliente que necesita este trabajo a ser realizado inmediatamente. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutencin. A futuro el desea abrir una imprenta propia. Vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero sin hijos. El cliente se siente satisfecho con los crditos que le otorgamos. Esta es la quinta vez que viene a IMPRO para solicitar un crdito y la segunda vez que se canaliza a travs de Kiva.
texts.en: Eric is employed at a graphics company as an offset printing machine operator. He's requesting this loan to buy printing material (ink, paper, etc.) in order to maintain his necessary clientele. This job is his principal source of income for his maintenance. In the future he hopes to open his own print shop. He lives at home with his parents in the city of La Paz; he's single and has no children. He's satisfied with the loans he's been granted. This is the fifth time that he's come to IMPRO to ask for a loan and the second time he's gone through Kiva.

loan.use: Purchase of ink, paper, and other materials to finish a job he's been entrusted with

loan.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old and sells spare parts for cars from her house. She also sells salchipapa (thinly sliced pan-fried sausage served with french fries).
She will use her loan of 1,000 PEN to buy more spare parts in Lima to sell in Ayacucho. Her business is doing well and she expects next month to be even better.
Roxana has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. Being a member provided her with the opportunity to study biology. With her earnings she is able to buy the books she needs. Saving money is what Roxana likes most about being a member, because she is not able to do that at home. From the training sessions provided, she said her self esteem has increased and she has also learned to be punctual.
Her goal is to finish her studies and open a bigger store to sell the spare car parts.

loan.use: To buy more spare car parts to resell

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 29 years. In 1996, he opened his own garage. He took advantage of a first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client, repaying on his scheduled dates.
Today, he is requesting to borrow $900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his business. His income is needed to support his wife and two young children.

loan.use: to purchase additional products

loan.name: Djatougb Benote

texts.fr: Madame Djatougb a 44 ans, marie avec 3 enfants charge. Elle habite quartier Ago Logop o elle fait le commerce de produits dalimentation. Elle a dbut en 1992 cette activit et sapprovisionne au grand march de Lom. Elle demande un crdit pour acheter 8 sacs du riz, 3 bidons dhuile, 2 cartons de tomate et 2 cartons de bote de sardine.
texts.en: Ms. Djatougb is 44 years old and married with 3 children in her care. She lives in the Ago Logop area, where she sells food products. She began this activity in 1992 and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lom. She is seeking a loan to buy 8 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 2 boxes of tomatoes, and 2 boxes of canned sardines.

loan.use: To buy food products

loan.name: Alicia

texts.es: La seora Alicia realiza trabajos de costura en pao (tela especial); el crdito lo necesita para el aumento de mercadera, compra de 2 pieas de pao, cada una de 50 metros. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene 4 hijos. La cliente se encuentra satisfecha con los crditos que se le otorgaron desde el ao 2005.
texts.en: Alicia works as a wool seamstress; she needs this loan to expand her merchandise. She's going to buy 2 swaths of woolen cloth, each 50 meters long. She lives in her own home located in the Alto Tejar area of the city of La Paz; she's married and has 4 children. She's satisfied with the loans she's received since 2005.

loan.use: Purchase of 100 meters of woolen cloth for her sewing business

loan.name: Gaston

texts.es: El seor Gastn trabaja como profesor y tambin es comerciante; el crdito que solicita es para que su hija cancele la inscripcin de ingreso a la Academia de Policas. Gaston es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. El seor se encuentra satisfecho con los crditos que se le otorga.Esta es la segunda vez que se canaliza su solicitud a travs de Kiva.
texts.en: Gastn works as a teacher and is also a salesman. He is requesting a loan so that he can cover the enrolment fee that his daughter must pay to enter the Police Academy. Gaston is married and has three children. He lives in his parents' home in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz. Gastn is happy with the loan that he is being offered. This is the second time that he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loan.use: To cover the enrolment fee that his daughter must pay to enter the Police Academy

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy household products to sell

loan.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio tiene un negocio donde presta el servicio de Internet, juegos en red y llamadas telefnicas. El prstamo lo destinara para la ampliacin de su negocio, pues desea comprar un par de computadoras ms. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutencin. Vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Marco Antonio es soltero.
Este es el Tercer crdito con Impro y el primero canalizado a travs de Kiva.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio has an internet cafe business where he also sells access to internet games and telephone calls. He will use this loan to expand his business, since he wants to buy two more computers. This business is his main source of income and support. He lives with his parents, whose home is located in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Marco Antonio is single.
This is his 3rd loan with IMPRO, and the first that has been funded through Kiva.

loan.use: to buy two computers to expand his internet cafe business

loan.name: John

texts.en: John is a 32-year-old farmer. He mainly does crop farming. He has been in business for ten years and has experienced a lot of growth since he joined Faulu Kenya. This is because he used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a water pump and expand his farm. He hopes to own a vehicle for transporting farm produce in the future. With 20,000 Kes, he will buy manure and pressure pipe.

loan.use: To buy manure and a pressure pipe

loan.name: John

texts.en: John is a member of Lucky Seven group in Faulu Kenya. He is 40 years old and the father of a seven-year-old child. He owns a van which he uses for a transport business. He also sells cereals so as to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business. He needs 30,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his van.

loan.use: vehicle repair

loan.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Ms. Eresmilda D. of O. who lives in Villa Rica.
Everybody was delighted to be a part of Mujeres Rurales, so they named the group "Mujeres Victoriosas" (Victorious Women). The members of the committe are engaged in handicrafts, which is a talent they inherited from their parents and which they pass on from generation to generation.
They make beautiful clothing items, such as shirts, tablecloths in aopoi fabric, etc. With the help offered by the foundation, this committee was able to increase its income and also improves the lifestyles of its members.
Mrs. Julia, for example, has been dedicated since childhood to traditional clothes manufacturing. She now wants to increase her income by advancing her business, and needs a loan to do so.

loan.use: buying raw materials for clothing manufacture

loan.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es: Marcial tiene 26 aos de edad es casado vive en casa propia con su esposa y su menor hijo de 06 aos el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente actualmente cuenta con un vehiculo propio en la cual trabaja de forma independiente el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para el mantenimiento y mejoramiento de su vehiculo, se le propone el crdito por tener buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Marcial is 26 years old and married. He lives in his own home with his wife and their minor child, who is 6 years old. He started out employed as a driver, and now has his own vehicle so he can work independently. The financing granted will be used to maintain and improve his vehicle. He was approved for the loan on the basis of having good references and having the willingness and ability to repay the loan.

loan.use: to maintain his vehicle

loan.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio es socio propietario en el sindicato de minibases Seor de San Roque; el crdito lo necesita para la compra de llantas y el mantenimiento de motor de su vehiculo. Este negocio es la nica fuente de ingreso que tiene. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto. Es primer crdito con Impro. Porfirio es soltero y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Porfirio owns a vehicle and belongs to the mini-bus syndicate called "Seor de San Roque." He needs this loan to buy tires and to do maintenance work on his vehicle. This business is the only source of income that he has. He lives in his own home, located in the San Roque neighborhood in the city of El Alto. This is his first loan with IMPRO. Porfirio is single and does not have children.

loan.use: To buy tires and do maintenance work on the motor of his vehicle, which he uses to provide public passenger transportation services.

loan.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La seora Florentina Quispe C. tiene 64 aos, vive en la zona de la Maica Central parada 6, una zona perifrica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en la zona sur oeste, vive con una de sus hijas, la cual es muy independiente de sus ingresos, su hija ya se encuentra casada. La seora Florentina fue desde muy joven madre sola porque su esposo las abandono, pero a pesar de todos obstculos que tuvo supo cuidar siempre a su familia. Ahora tiene bajo su cuidado a un nio a quien lo quiere y cuida como uno de sus hijos a pesar de no serlo.
La seora Florentina se dedica a la produccin de leche cruda, la cual la comercializa en la zona, a las productoras de quesillos, cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno y ella sola se dedica al cuidado de este ganado, se levanta temprano, los ordea, y los lleva a pastorear (comer pasto) en la zona, y por las tardes las alimenta con alafalfa, alimento balanceado y cascara de soya, esto para que la produccin de las vacas sea ms ptima, y al finalizar el da las vuelve a ordear 8estraccion de leche cruda).
La seora Florentina desea comprar forraje para el ganado vacuno (cascara de soya) para no comprar solo por bolsas desea comprar medio camin que le resulta ms econmico, de este modo se ahorra un poco ms, y como tiene a su cuidado al muchacho que le hace compaa, le podr mejores condiciones de vida. Cuando el joven termine de estudiar el colegio, la Sra. Florentina le dejara todas sus vacas a l para que se dedique al mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Florentina Quispe C. is 64 years old and lives in the Maica Central neighborhood near bus stop 6. This is a neighborhood that is on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba, on the southeast side. She lives with one of her daughters, who has her own independent income and who is married. Florentina was a very young single mother, because her husband abandoned her. But in spite of all of the obstacles she faced, she was always able to care for her family. Now she is raising a young child who she loves and cares for as if he were one of her own.
Florentina has a business producing raw milk, which she sells in the neighborhood to the cheese producers. She has 6 dairy cows, and she alone cares for these cows. She gets up early, milks them, and puts them out to pasture in the area. In the afternoons she feeds them with alfalfa, balanced feed and soybean husks, so that she can optimize their production of milk. At the end of the day she milks them again.
Florentina wants to buy fodder for her dairy cows (soybean husks.) She wants to buy a half-truck full instead of bags, because it is more economical and in this way she could save a little more. As a result, she and the boy who is in her care could have a better quality of life. When the boy finishes school, Florentina will leave him all of her cows so that he can have the same business.

loan.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows

loan.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, es comerciante de libros, el crdito que solicita ser utilizado en compra de ms libros para su puesto de venta en la ciudad de La Paz; est divorciada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 aos de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres, en zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto. Es el segundo crdito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en: Lucy is a bookseller. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more books for her sales stall in the city of La Paz. Lucy is divorced and has two children aged 13 and 9. She lives in her parents' home, in Mariscal Sucre district, in the city of El Alto. This is her second loan from IMPRO and her second through Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more books for her stall

loan.name: Ladislaa

texts.en:
Ms. Ladislaa is 43 years old and she is the local tailor. She is married to Mr. Jorge Luis Vazquez, a 39 year old construction worker. They have 2 kids, and they own a small apparel shop (aopoi clothing) in their house.
It started 7 years ago with the help of Ms. Ladislaa's mother, who takes care of making the clothes. Ms. Ladislaa requested the loan to buy aopoi fabrics, canvas, thread, buttons, rubber, etc., which will help her to increase the amount of work done.
She is very thankful to Kiva and the foundation for the support offered. Thanks to that she can still make top notch clothing items and sell them at a good price to maintain her clientele. Her income can also increase, allowing her to help her husband, pay the house expenses, and pay for her kids' education.

loan.use: Buying fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loan.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos , es un joven de 25 aos de edad ,originario de Esteli, soltero quien vive con su madre ,y que se dedica a ayudarle en la contabilidad a su mama en el negocio de frutas .Empezo a los 14 aos cuando su familia empezo a vender en el diamante de las Segovia municipio de Esteli,esta cursando la universidad estudiando la carrera de Contaduria Publica en Esteli,pues no pierde la fe de sacar adelante a su familia dandoles una mejor calidad de vida. El solicita el prestamo para capital de trabajo , pues de esta manera podra comprar mas frutas y venderlas por cantidad y surtir mejor su negocio, mejorar sus ventas, considera que es una buena temporada para vender sus productos. Dentro de sus planes esta lograr culminar su carrera , desarrollarse profesionalmente y seguir ayudando a su madre . Su meta proxima es comprar un vehiculo para trasladar frutas desde Managua a Esteli.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old and from Esteli. He is single and lives with his mother. He helps his mom with the book keeping for her fruit business. He started at the age of 14 when his family started selling in Diamante de las Segovia, in the town of Esteli. Carlos is at university, studying for a degree in certified public accounting, in Esteli. He does not lose faith in being able to get his family ahead in life, providing them with a better quality of life.
Carlos is requesting this loan as working capital as it will enable him to buy more fruit, sell in bulk, better stock his business and improve his sales. He says that this is a good season to sell his products. Amongst his plans is managing to finish his degree, making progress professionally and continuing to help his mother. His short-term goal is to buy a vehicle so that he can transport fruit from Managua to Esteli.

loan.use: To buy fruit

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La seora Mara Guadalupe es una persona seria, responsable, y sobre todo muy trabajadora ella esta separada de su esposo, tiene a su cargo a una nia para la que quiere la mejor educacin, la seora Mara necesita el dinero para poder arreglar un poco su casa ya que ella va a poner una barda y quiere mayor seguridad para su familia y para ella ya que se encuentra sola.
texts.en: Mara Guadalupe is a responsible and above all hardworking person. She and her husband are separated. She looks after their daughter, for whom she wants the best education. Mara needs the loan for home improvements, for example, to build a surrounding wall to provide greater security for her and her family.

loan.use: Construccion de una barda

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Operating capital to buy more natural products

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 51aos de edad, naci en la comarca el Coyolito, la Concordia municipio de Jinotega, es casada con tres hijos, es comerciante y ama de casa, ya que atiende una pulpera. Inicio el negocio de la pulpera con ayuda de su marido en la comarca el Coyolito localizada 28 kilmetros de Estel, trasladando el producto desde Estel hasta la comunidad para poder venderlo. Adems se dedican a la venta de leche pues poseen ganado y esto les ayuda a pagar los estudios de sus tres hijos, que es su prioridad ya que ella no pudo terminar su secundaria por problemas econmicos y el difcil acceso a los lugares de estudios. Ella espera que al ampliar su negocio ella mejorara sus ingresos. Solicita el prstamo para ampliar y abastecer el negocio, poder abastecerse de la mayor cantidad de producto y vender ms, y generar mayores ingresos. Sus planes son darles estudios completos a sus hijos, poder convertirse en una gran distribuidora donde pueda solventar las necesidades de consumo de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old and was born in the town of Concordia in the Department of Jinotega, Coyolito region. She is married and has three children. Francisca is a merchant and housewife who manages her own store. She started this business with the help of her husband and established it in Coyolito region, which is 28 kilometers from Estel. Her products are brought into her community from Estel so that she can sell them. In addition, she owns dairy cows and sells the milk to help pay for the education of her three children. They are her highest priority since she was not able to finish high school because of financial problems and difficulty accessing the schools. Francisca hopes to expand her business in order to improve her income.

She is requesting this loan in order to expand and restock her business. By restocking with a large quantity of products, Francisca will be able to sell more and generate better revenues. Her plans include helping her children complete their education and becoming a large distributor so that she can meet the consumer needs of her community.

loan.use: Acquire a large quantity of products for her store

loan.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.en:
July is the leader of the Community Bank named Soleil Plus which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
July is 57, married, and has been part of the micro-enterprise world for many years. He operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa.
He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $180 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. July is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having eight times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of sugar, and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. July has six children aged between 12 and 26 years old. All of them attend school.

loan.use: expanding store inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline owns a restaurant. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children who are between six and seventeen years old. Her husband sells cattle. Jacqueline has been selling cooked food in her restaurant for two years. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a motorcycle which will be used for transportation.

loan.use: Buying foodstuffs

loan.name: Jose Emanuel

texts.es: Jos Emanuel V. M., tiene la edad de 33 aos, est casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su seora esposa. El cuenta con una soda y quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio. Por lo cual el pretende con el prstamo comprar ms mercadera para ofrecer una gran mayora de comidas o platillos. El tambin piensa en el futuro de su hijo y su esposa, al igual pretende brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y que su hijo no tenga ninguna necesidad para sus estudios, pues el quiere que sea un gran profesional en el futuro. Es el primer prstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no haba tenido antes otros prstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el prstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho ms baja.
texts.en:
Jos Emanuel V. M. is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Both his wife and child are his greatest priority. Jos manages a soda fountain and wants to continue growing his business. For this reason, he intends to use his loan to buy more supplies so that he can offer a wide variety of snacks and dishes. He also thinks about the future for his son and wife, as well as providing them a better quality of life. His son has no need for his studies, yet he still wants him to become a successful professional in the future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Jos has not taken any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better services and a much lower interest rate.

loan.use: Purchase more supplies for his soda fountain

loan.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La Sra. Ofelia T. Q. es una persona muy seria y responsable, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, su nico ingreso es su tienda de abarrotes, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y desea ampliar su tienda futuro para as poner ofrecer mayor mercanca a sus clientes , su esposo el Sr. Ral Arturo le ayuda a la seora en los tiempos libres que el tenga ya que el es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta el cual quiere ver a su familia llena y completa de felicidad y alegra ofrecindoles un mejor hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia T. Q. is a very serious and responsible individual. She is married and has two children who are dependent on her. Her only source of income is her grocery store. Ofelia is an enterprising person and wants to expand her store in the future so that she can offer more merchandise to her customers.

Her husband, Sr. Ral Arturo, helps her whenever he has free time. Ofelia is hardworking and honest. By providing a better home, she hopes to see her family full of happiness and joy.

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Josiane is the leader and a member of "Abatoni" group. She is 48 years old and she has six children. Her children are between the ages of 15 and 29 years old. All her children go or have gone to school. She sells different foodstuffs such as cassava, beans, beer and sodas.
Generally the rest of the group members sell foodstuffs while some have shops in which they sell household items. They are requesting a loan in order to invest in their businesses.
Josiane is shown in the photograph holding their blue bank passbook.

loan.use: Buying additional stocks of foodstuffs and drinks

loan.name: Maria Alma Delia

texts.es: La Sra. Mara Alma B., es una mama divorciada que vive al lado de sus dos hijos uno mayor de edad que ya es independiente y esta trabajando para ayudarla con los gastos, y el menor que se encuentra estudiando, actualmente la Sra. alma no ha encontrado trabajo en alguna empresa, y desde hace ya casi un ao que ella para seguir con la manutencin de sus hijos y de su hogar, inicio el negocio de la venta de zapatos por catalogo, pero como a ella le estn solicitando mas producto ella desea invertir capital en comprar de estos, y tener en existencia para mostrar a sus clientes, y as que puedan ver la variedad de zapatos, ya que le ha dado frutos la venta de este producto y as es como ha logrado seguir sacando adelante la manutencin de sus hijos y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Mara Alma B. is a divorced mother who lives with her two children. The oldest child is already independent and working to help with the expenses, while the younger one is in school. Sra. Alma currently does not have a job with any company. It has been almost a year since she held a job that allowed her to support her children and her household.

Sra. Alma started a business selling shoes through a catalog. She wants to order more products, but needs the capital to invest so that she can purchase them. Alma has an existing inventory that she can display to her customers, but they want to see a wider variety of shoes. Selling shoes has paid off because she can continue supporting her children and maintaining her home.

loan.use: Purchase shoes to sell

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Sonia es madre de dos hijas, con deseo de superacin profesional. En donde ha logrado mantenerse estable en su trabajo. Como auditora. Atreves de los aos ha venido construyendo su casa con ahorros y financiamiento que ha logrado en Afodenic en cuatro periodos, todos con el objetivo de poder dar a sus hijas un techo digno. Hoy con esta nueva solicitud, comprara materiales de construccin para terminar un cuarto el cual lo tiene casi ya terminado, lo que comprara es laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos para el techo, a si como puertas y ventana para concluir la obra.
texts.en:
Sonia is a mother of two daughters, with a wish to improve herself professionally. She has managed to maintain a stable job as an auditor. Through the years she has built her house with her savings and with loans from Afodenic on 4 occasions, all with the objective of being able to give her daughters a worthy roof over their heads.
Today with this new loan she will buy construction materials to finish a room which is almost done. She will buy sheets of tin, support beams, screws for the roof, as well as doors and a window to finish the work.

loan.use: Buy construction materials to finish the roof and doors of a room

loan.name: Gladys

texts.es: Orden y trabajo, son las virtudes de Gladys, una mujer de 48 aos. Su familia lo conforma sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en La Merced (selva central peruana). La venta de productos de belleza, es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 8 aos; en todo este tiempo logr obtener muchos clientes, quienes constantemente le hacen pedidos de cremas faciales, perfumes, bloqueadores y dems accesorios. Gracias a las facilidades de pago que ofrece, todos sus clientes estn contentos con ella, pero afirma que tiene dificultades para cobrar. Pues hace unos meses comenz a trabajar para el estado peruano, en la cobranza ambulatoria de los comerciantes. Por esa razn, desea instalar una cabaa turstica, donde pueda contratar un personal para que le ayude en la venta de sus productos y dems artculos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Las optimistas, y este es el sexto crdito que tiene con MFP, donde demuestra responsabilidad, ya que es la secretaria de su asociacin. Gladys, comenzar la construccin de la cabaa, por ello con el crdito solicitado, est pensando comprar los insumos necesarios. As podr vender aretes, ropa, y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Organization and hard work are the virtues that Gladys exhibits. She is a 48 year old woman. Her family consists of four children, but only two of them still live with her in their home in La Merced (which is in the central Peruvian jungle). Gladys has been selling beauty products for eight years. Throughout that time, she has been able to acquire many customers who constantly place orders for facial creams, perfumes, sunscreens, and other accessories. Thanks to the payment options she offers, all of her customers are happy with her yet she still has difficulties collecting payments. A few months ago, Gladys started working for the Peruvian state government as a traveling debt collector assigned to the merchants. For this reason, she wants to establish a tourist stand so that she can hire an employee to help with the sale of her products and other articles from her existing business.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank Las Optimistas (The Optimists). This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has demonstrated responsibility through her service as secretary of her association. Gladys will begin the construction of her stand, so the loan she requested will be used to buy the necessary supplies. This will enable her to have a place where she can sell earrings, clothing, and beauty products.

loan.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can build a stand for her business

loan.name: Vie Nouvelle Plus Group

texts.en:
"Vie Nouvelle Plus" (New Life Plus) is a group of 22 owners of small businesses chaired by Dorange. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
Dorange, single and aged 30, runs a clothing stand while taking care of two relatives. She has been in business for many years. Dorange has used seven Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of her inventory. Due to the high demand in her community, she intends with the next loan to buy still more goods for resale in order to meet clients' demand and generate additional profit. This will help her to achieve her plans to grow the business. It brings in a profit of US$100 per week.
Doranges ambition is to purchase goods abroad herself. She is engaged.

loan.use: purchasing additional goods for her store for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Amor Y Paz 1 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Albaneli es la coordinadora del grupo Amor y Paz 3, cada uno D. elL. das a das realizan sus actividades D. negocios en la ciudad D. Santiago, la segunda ciudad mas granD. D. Republica Dominicana, donD. el comercio, grandes industrias y el sector D. ganadera y agricultura, son las principales fuentes D. trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosmticos, alimentos, entre otros productos miscelneos.
Albaneli posee una familia conformada por sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Mientras su esposo trabaja para suplir las necesidades bsica D. su familia, ella se ha dedicado a generar ingresos extra, actualmente con la finalidad D. poder reparar poco a poco su vivienda y poder construir en una estructura fuerte D. block, para garantizar mas seguridad. Su sueo es poder tener su casa terminada, y tambin tener una gran compaa, este ultimo es su reto mas importante.
El negocio D. Albaneli es la venta D. calzado, lleva ya alrededor D. 1 ao, el cual inicio al recibir su primer prstamo. Esta recibiendo su 3er prstamos con Esperanza Internacional. Gracias a L. prestamos anteriores ha podido crecer su negocio D. zapatos, y ha podido unirse a la venta D. calzados por catalogo D. mayor calidad. Este nuevo prstamo ser invertido en la compra D. calzados para mujeres, D. diferentes estiL., colores y tamaos; y reforzar una segunda actividad D. negocio que recin incorporo, es la venta D. salchichas a la parrilla.
Su historia representa a L. dems miembros D. su grupo y a L. clientes D. Esperanza, tanto L. haitianos (quienes en su mayora ha emigrado hacia la Repblica Dominicana desD. Hait, algunos D. elL. recientemente) y L. dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en la Repblica Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energa elctrica constante.
texts.en:
Albaneli is the coordinator for the group Amor y Paz 3 (Love and Peace 3). All of the members conduct their daily business activities in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. The main sources of jobs are traD., large industries, and the livestock and agriculture sectors. These members mostly engage in the sale of clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Albanelis family consists of her three children and her husband. While her husband works to meet the basic needs of their family, Albaneli spends time earning extra income. At the moment, she wants to complete the gradual repairs to her home and build a structure maD. of solid block that is guaranteed to be secure. Her dreams incluD. finishing her house and having a large business. The latter goal is the most important to her.

Albaneli has been selling shoes for approximately one year and used her first loan to start this business. She is now receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to grow her shoe business and incorporate the sale of higher quality shoes from a catalog. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of womens shoes in different styles, colors, and sizes. She will also strengthen a second business she recently started, selling grilled sausages.

Albanelis story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in the poorest communities of the Dominican Republic that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loan.use: Purchase womens shoes in different styles, colors, and sizes

loan.name: Omar

texts.es: El joven Omar M. M. es un hombre muy emprendedor pues comenta que hace algunos aos se quedo sin empleo y su padre le propuso que lo enseara a preparar donas lo logro y empez con la ventas de donas primero con su familia posteriormente en algunas tiendas de su colonia despus consigui un empleo formal pero comenta que el desea su crdito para la compra de un caso de cobre puesto que ahora combina su trabajo con la venta de donas ya que realiza su venta con los mismos compaeros de trabajo.
texts.en: Omar M. M. is an enterprising young man who says that he lost his job a few years ago. His father proposed to teach him how to make donuts. He began selling donuts first to family members and later to a few stores in the area. Afterwards he secured formal employment. Omar says that he wants this loan to buy a copper pot. Now he supplements his job by selling donuts to his co-workers.

loan.use: Purchase a copper pot for frying donuts

loan.name: Cirila

texts.es: Perseverancia; as definimos a Cirila, una mujer de 61 aos; que vive junto a su esposo Teodoro, y sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo cra y educa a Andrea de 18 aos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Todos los das desde muy temprano, Cirila recorre las calles de la ciudad; ofreciendo los ricos tamales que prepara un da antes. A pesar del cansancio que siente, ella se mantiene firme y comenta que no llega a su casa sin haber terminado todos los tamales que prepar, lo cual no es tan difcil, pues gracias a lo exquisita sazn, y a los clientes que adquiri durante 10 aos, ella puede vender diariamente 80 tamales. Ya en las noches, afuera de su casa, ella vende anticuchos y picarones, ateniendo as un dinerito extra. Ahora sus planes son construir un pequeo quiosco, donde pueda vender los ricos platos que cocina, y de esa manera no estar caminando y establecer su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Las Optimistas, y este es el quinto crdito con MFP, donde espera obtener este aporte para el desarrollo de su negocio. Cirila, comenzar la construccin de su quiosco, por ello con el crdito que recibir, comprar madera y clavos; asimismo comprar insumos para la elaboracin de tamales, picarones y anticuchos.
texts.en:
Perseverance is what defines Cirila. She is a 61 year old woman. She lives with her husband and six children, but her daughter Andrea (age 18) is the only one who is still a dependent and attends school. Cirila lives in her own home in the city of La Merced, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. Every day she travels through the streets of her city from the early morning hours, offering the rich tamales that she prepared the day before. Despite the fatigue, she remains firm and says that she does not go home until all of her tamales have been sold. Cirila has no difficulty with selling all of her product since her food has an exquisite flavor. She accumulated her customers over the course of ten years and is able to sell 80 tamales per day. At night, Cirila sells skewered meats and fritters outside of her home so that she can earn some extra money. Now she plans to build a small kiosk where she can sell the rich dishes she prepares. This will enable her to have an established business so that she does not have to walk.

Cirila belongs to the Communal Bank Las Optimistas (The Optimists). This is her fifth loan with MFP. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can develop her business. Cirila will begin the construction of her kiosk, so the loan she received will be used to buy wood and nails. In addition, she will buy supplies for making tamales, fritters, and skewered meats.

loan.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation & construction materials to build a kiosk for her business

loan.name: Azul X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama AZUL X, en honor a la nieta de la Tesorera en base a la admiracin que le tienen por salir adelante, ya que tiene sindorme de dawn. El grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, Mxico. Esta formado por 10 integrantes. La Presidenta del grupo es Doa MARIA GUADALUPE C. J., quien tiene 39 aos,es casada y tiene dos hijos, estudi hasta la primaria. Se dedica a la venta de joyeria. La Tesorera del grupo es MARIA ENGRACIA A. C., quien tiene 44 aos, es casada y estudi hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella solicito el crdito para realizar pedidos por adelantado y obtener mayores ganancias, ella ha salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacin; sus compaeras la conocen desde hace tiempo y comentan que es una persona trabajadora y honesta, ella solicita el crdito para apoyar a su familia y tener una vida de calidad.
texts.en:
This group is called Azul X in honor of the treasurers granddaughter who is greatly admired for the drive to succeed she demonstrates each day beginning at dawn. The group is located in the State of Puebla in Mexico and consists of ten members. Doa Maria Guadalupe C. J. is the group president. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Maria Guadalupe has an elementary school education and sells jewelry.

The group treasurer is Maria Engracia A. C. She is 44 years old, married, and has a high school education. Maria Engracia sells clothing. She is requesting a loan so that she can place orders in advance and generate more revenue. Maria Engracia has been able to get ahead because of her effort and dedication. Her fellow group members have known her for a long time and comment that she is a hardworking and honest individual. She is requesting a loan to help support her family and have a better quality of life.

loan.use: Operating capital to use as business investment

loan.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: Jose tiene 46 aos de edad es separado tiene dos hijas de 20 y 12 aos el vive con su hija la mayor en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Urb La Palma Jose se dedica aproximadamente dos aos al transporte labora de forma independiente en su propio vehiculo realizando el servicio de colectivo, el financiamiento sera destinado para el mantenimiento de su auto se le otorga el crdito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old, separated, and has two daughters (ages 20 and 12). He lives with his eldest daughter at his parents' house in Urb La Palma. Jose has been providing transportation services for approximately two years. He works independently, using his own vehicle that he acquired from the taxi cooperative.

This loan will be used for automobile maintenance. Jose is being granted this loan because he presents good references as well as the willingness and capacity to pay.

loan.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loan.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.es:
Damaris posee una familia conformada por ella y su pequea hija. Al ser madre soltera ha iniciado con su negocio con la intencin de buscar un futuro mejor para ella y su hija, que pueda tener dinero suficiente y una estabilidad econmica con la cual pueda dar un mejor estilo de vida, pueda seguir estudiando completando su formacin universitaria y a la vez poder pagar los estudios a su hija. Su actividad favorita es jugar con su nia.
Damaris es una de los miembros del grupo Fe y Amor 5, cada uno de ellos das a das realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Santiago, la segunda ciudad ms grande de Republica Dominicana, donde el comercio, grandes industrias y el sector de ganadera y agricultura, son las principales fuentes de trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosmticos, alimentos, entre otros productos miscelneos.
Damaris inicio su negocio de venta de ropa por encargo, de modo ambulante visitaba clientes y preguntaba que necesitaban, luego iba y les compraba, en la actualidad ha podido gracias a los prestamos poder tener mayor mercancas y poder comprar para ella revender a mas clientes, ahora llega con productos, y puede mostrarlos. Este nuevo prstamo ser invertido en la compra de pantalones jeans de hombre y mujeres; y sus ganancias sern usadas para ahorrar y poder suplir su negocio en algn momento que sea necesario y le falte capital, ya que tambin con sus clientes ms fieles suele venderles a crdito. Gracias por su apoyo, en nombre del grupo Fe y amor.
texts.en:
Damaris family is composed of herself and her young daughter. Being a single mother, she started her business seeking a better future for herself and her daughter, to have enough income and economic stability that will lead to a better living standard, to continue going to the university as well as afford her daughters schooling costs. Her favorite activity is playing with her daughter.
Damaris is a member of the Fe y Amor 5 (Faith & Love 5) group. Each one of them daily carries out business activities in the city of Santiago, the Dominican Republics second largest city, where commerce, large industry, cattle raising and agriculture are the main sources of employment. They mostly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and food, among other miscellaneous products.
Damaris started her business selling clothes on order door to door; she visited customers asking what they needed, and then shed go buy it. Thanks to loans shes been able to have more merchandise and be able to buy to resell to more customers. Now she arrives with goods to show. This new loan will be used to buy jeans for men and women. Profits will be saved and also used to stock the business whenever necessary and when she lacks capital since she tends to sell to her most reliable customers on credit.
Thanks for your support in the name of the Fe y Amor group.

loan.use: To buy jeans.

loan.name: Jesus

texts.es: Don Jess, de 52 aos, casado con 5 hijos a su cargo, es comerciante, originario del departamento de Estel. A duras penas logro terminar la primaria pues su situacin econmica lo obligo a dejar a temprana edad sus estudios. Inicio en una empacadora, localizada en el costado sur del hospital de Estel, su primer trabajo fue como vendedor de pan ah duro 3 aos. Luego tomo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio empez a trabajar solo , con crditos que le otorgaron diferentes micro financieras llegando obtener una lnea de crdito de hasta C$3,000.00(Tres Mil Crdobas Netos). En l actualidad se dedica a vender pan, ya que es un producto masivo y le ha ido muy bien pues desde muy joven ha conocido este negocio. Esta solicitando el crdito para capital de trabajo, necesita invertirlo en compra de materia prima , y de nuevos producto como la rosquilla somotea ya que este producto tiene gran demanda entre su clientela. Su prxima meta es hacer crecer el negocio, tener su propio capital de trabajo, darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda,teniendo estabilidad economica atraves de su negocio.
texts.en: 52 year old Don Jess is married and has 5 children to care for. He is a merchant and a native of the city of Estel. Although it was a hard struggle, he was able to finish elementary school. However, his economic situation meant that he left school at an early age. He began working in a packing plant to the south of Estel hospital. His first job was selling bread there, which he did for 3 years. Later, he took the initiative to start his own business and began to work for himself, using loans from various micro-finances institutions he had a line of credit up to $3,000 net (in Crdobas). He currently sells bread as it is an always-needed product and he is doing very well because he has understood this business since he was very young. He is requesting a loan for working capital. He needs to buy raw materials and new products such as a type of donut that is in great demand by his customers. His next goal is to grow his business and have his own business capital so he can give his children a better standard of living and improve their home. He hopes his business will bring them economic stability.

loan.use: To buy raw materials and new food products

loan.name: Marisol

texts.es: La Srita. Marisol, es enfermera de profesin, pero ella se ha especializado en enfermedades de personas con discapacidad, como embolias, parlisis temporal entre otros , pero como ella da servicio a domicilio porque la contratan por temporadas, a ella le hacen falta varios aparatos que requiere para dar una terapia mas profesional a sus pacientes, y dice que al tener estos aparatos, siente que va a dar un mejor servicio, y la van a recomendar mas las personas que ya han estado trabajando con ella y le han confiado el cuidado de sus seres queridos, por lo que ella se siente muy afortunada como enfermera de hacer este tipo de trabajos, es por eso que le pagan honorarios por el cuidado del paciente y a pesar de que ya a adquirido algunos aparatos ella quiere estar siempre actualizada, ya que su profesin la hace ser mas humana.
texts.en: Marisol is a nurse buy profession, but she has specialized in treating people with disabilities such as strokes and temporary paralysis, among others. She works from home, and also does seasonal contract work, and she does not have all the equipment that she needs to offer her patients the most professional therapy. She says that, if she had this equipment, she would be able to provide better service, and most of the people who have worked with her would recommend her to their loved ones. She feels very fortunate to work as a nurse, and this is why people pay for her work. Although she has already bought some equipment, she wants to always be updating. Her profession makes her feel more human.

loan.use: To buy physical therapy equipment

loan.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Diana es socia y una D. las 9 integrantes D. L. Alcanca Comunal Luz D. san Antonio, es conviviente y tiene 3 nios dependientes. Se hizo partcipe mediante L. convocatoria D. una D. las socias que organizo al grupo. Diana se dedica hace 2 aos a L. venta D. comida rpida como: salchipapas, alitas D. pollo fritas y hamburguesas, debido a L. necesidad D. aportar en los gastos D. su familia y como apoyo a su conyugue. Hasta L. fecha ha logrado adquirir algunos electrodomsticos para mejorar su calidad D. vida y asume mensualmente el pago D. algunos servicios bsicos en su hogar, nos manifiesta que si tuviera ms capital lo invertira en L. compra D. prendas D. vestir para nios y adultos para comercializar y obtener ms ingresos. El prstamo que obtuvo esta vez ser invertido en L. compra D. pollo, papas y algunos tiles escolares que necesitan sus hijos. Diana y sus socias D. L. alcanca comunal Luz D. san Antonio son responsables y puntuales mes tras mes. En L. fotografa podemos apreciar a Diana acompaada D. su nia.
texts.en: Diana is one of the 9 members of the loan group "Luz D. San Antonio." She lives with her partner and has 3 dependent children. She became a member of the group at the invitation of one of the organizing members. For 3 years, Diana has had a business selling fast food such as salchipapas (a typical dish of sausage and potatoes), chicken wings, and burgers. She works to contribute to the household income and help her partner. To date, she has bought some domestic appliances that improve her quality of life and has taken on making the monthly payments for some of their utilities. She tells us that, if she had more capital to invest she would buy children's and adult's clothing to sell and make more income. She will use the loan that she is requesting now to buy chicken, potatoes, and some school supplies that her children need. Diana and her companions in the loan group Luz D. San Antonio are responsible and punctual month after month. We can see Diana in the photo with her daughter.

loan.use: To buy chicken, potatoes, and school supplies

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy sodas, bread, cookies, donuts, butter, rice, beans, four, sugar, coffee, soups, chicken, spaghettis, chili, chile, candy, mosquito repellant, veneno para mosquitos, matches, and candles.

loan.name: La Cosecha 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Bertha es la coordinadora del grupo La Cosecha 3 y 4, Grupo formado por 10 mujeres empresarias de la ciudad de Los Alcarrizos, ubicada al oeste de la provincia de Santo Domingo, siendo una de las comunidades mas pobladas y mas rurales de la capital de Republica Dominicana. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosmticos, alimentos, entre otros productos miscelneos.
La F. de Bertha esta compuesta por ella, su esposo y sus 3 hijos, todos comparten y viven bajo el mismo techo, de una casa humilde, en una zona de escasos recursos econmicos y de servicios. Sus planes es poder tener una buena tapicera, con muchos clientes y que se puedan fabricar y vender muebles de todo tipo. Sus retos es poder educar a sus hijos y proveerles lo que necesiten para salir adelante.
Bertha se dedica a la tapicera, y a la reparacin de muebles, gracias a sus conocimientos ha podido crear este negocio, un poco escaso en la zona en la que vive; desea ampliar sus servicios y fabricar muebles para vender a buen precio pero con buena calidad. Esta muy emocionada de recibir su segundo prstamo con Esperanza y con este va a invertirlo en la compra de telas, accesorios, madera y algunas herramientas que necesita para su negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y es un ejemplo para su F. y las dems mujeres en su grupo.
texts.en:
Bertha is the coordinator of the "La Cosecha 3 y 4" (The Harvest 3 and 4) group which is made up of 10 enterprising women from the city of Los Alcarrizos which is located in the east of Santo Domingo province. It is one of the most populated and rural areas of the Domincan Republic's capital city. The women mainly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products.
Bertha's family consists of herself, her husband and her 3 children. They all live under the same roof, in a humble house, in an area which is poor both in financial terms and in terms of services. Bertha's plans are to own a good upholstery business with many customers, making and selling all kinds of furniture. Her challenges are to educate her children and to provide them with what they need to get ahead in life.
Bertha works as an upholsterer and also repairs furniture. Thanks to her knowledge, she has been able to create this business which is quite scarce in the area in which she lives. She would like to expand her services and make good-quality furniture to sell at a good price. She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza and will invest the money in buying fabric, accessories, wood and some tools that she needs for her business. She is a very hard-working woman and is an example for her family and the other women in her group.

loan.use: To buy fabric and accessories for upholstering furniture

loan.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 62 aos ,habita en el Espinal comunidad cercana al departamento de Estel, es casado con tres hijos , se dedica a la siembra de granos, es agricultor. Comenz sus actividades de siembra y ganadera con ayuda de su padre en la comunidad el Espinal a 20 kilmetros al sur de Estel. Desde temprana edad se dedicaba ayudarle por las tardes a su papa arriar el ganado y en las maanas asista a la escuela. Su primer cosecha fue a los 18 aos donde sembr su propia parcela de granos bsicos con la cual pudo comprar ganado, as permitindole mejorar su casa y la ampliacin de su propiedad. Hoy en da se dedica a la siembra de granos bsicos y en pocas bajas a la venta y compra de ganado. Solicita el prstamo para completar 1 1/2 manzana de frijol de riego para comprar los insumos y fertilizantes, pues esto le ser de gran ayuda para el y su familia, ya que con el dinero se apoyara para la compra de semilla e insumos para garantizar mayores rendimientos en sus cosechas. Sus planes futuros son que con la inversin del frijol de riego ya no tenga que comprarlo sino que ser el que se convierta en el mayor abastecedor de su zona, bridarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos atraves de una buena educacin profesional.
texts.en: Juan is 62 years old. He lives in the community of Espinal, close to the department of Estel. He is married with three children. He is a farmer and sows grain. He began growing crops and raising livestock with the help of his father in the community of Espinal, 20 km to the south of Estel. From an early age, he helped his father bring down the cattle in the afternoons and in the mornings he went to school. He had his first harvest when he was 18, when he sowed his own parcel of grains and used the profits to buy cattle. In this way, he was able to improve his house and expand his land. Today, he grows grains and in the quite times he sells and buys cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy supplements and fertilizer to treat 1 1/2 parcels of irrigated beans. This will be of great help to him and his family as he will be able to buy seed and supplements to achieve higher crop yields. His future plan is that the investment in bean irrigation will mean that he becomes one of the biggest suppliers in the area and no longer has to buy beans. The will enable him to offer his children a better future and a good professional education.

loan.use: To buy supplements and fertilizer to treat 1 1/2 parcels of irrigated beans

loan.name: Itzel Anaiht

texts.es: La Srita. Itzel Anaiht es una persona muy joven y trabajadora ya que ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada que atiende los fines de semana ya que adems ella trabaja en una maquiladora por que ayuda a la economa de su casa ella quiere adquir mercanca puesto que sus clientes le realizan pedidos.
texts.en:
Itzel Anaiht is a very young, hard working person who has a clothing business on weekends because she also works in an assembly plant to help with family expenses.
She wants to acquire merchandise because her customers have placed orders with her.

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy milk, soap, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, beans, lard, oil, margarine, chili sauce, flour, soft drinks, tomato sauce, pasta, soups, juices, spices, toothpaste and toilet paper.

loan.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea madre soltera mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, agricultora como planes mejora infraestructura de la vivienda para tener seguridad y proteccin. Inicio con apoyo de la reforma agraria, se le presenta dificulta con las enfermedades y plagas. Tiene de proyecto la conservacin de suelo y siembro de abono verdes para obtener mayores productos. El prstamo ser utilizado en la compra insecticidas brindando el manejo de fito sanitario al cultivo.
texts.en:
Andrea is a single mother. She is an enterprising hardworking woman who works as a farmer. Andrea plans to improve the infrastructure of her home in order to provide greater security and protection. She started farming as a result of land reform. The main difficulties she faces are diseases and pests.

Andrea is undertaking a soil conservation project and will also apply green composts on her crops so that she can increase her productivity. This loan will be used to buy insecticides so that she can manage the health of her plants.

loan.use: Purchase insecticides

loan.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Mr. Ramon is 41 years old; he is married and has two kids. He is a builder, and he performs plumbing work, carpentry and masonry in general. He first began over 10 years ago, so he takes care of the supervision and execution of different jobs.
He requested this loan from the Foundation so he could buy shovels, buckets, hammers, nails, etc., to perform good quality work. These are items that need renewal due to constant use. Mr. Ramon thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the support and help given; because of that he can take more jobs and increase his income, thus improving his family's living conditions.

loan.use: The buying of shovels, buckets, hammers, nails, etc.

loan.name: Giovannia Maria

texts.es: Giovannia es una joven de 23 aos de edad, casada, madre de un hijo. Su esposo labora como ejecutivo de cartera y cobro en una empresa privada. Siendo su negocio la venta de cosmticos, bisutera, manualidades teniendo cuatro aos en las ventas, anteriormente laboraba en una tienda de manualidades, la cual cerr y se ha dedicado completamente al comercio. Como objetivo es el mejoramiento de su vivienda el cual opto al financiamiento para lograr esta mejora de un bajarete en frente de su casa, asi como la compra de puertas que estn en mal estado. Comprara materiales como: laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, madera, a si como puerta lo que est contenta por la probacin que Afodenic est otorgando atreves del crdito. El cual podr equilibrar sus gastos y poder cumplir sus compromiso de pago.
texts.en:
Giovannia is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband works as a billing and collections manager for a private business. Giovannia has a business selling cosmetics, trinkets, and handicrafts that she started four years ago. She previously worked at a crafts store, but the store went out of business, so she decided to become a small businesswoman full-time.

One of Giovannias goals is to make improvements to her home, so she has opted to seek financing in order to build a veranda at the front of her house. She will also buy doors to replace the existing ones that are in bad condition, as well as construction materials such as sheets of zinc, beams, nails, and wood. Giovannia is happy that AFODENIC has extended this credit opportunity to her so that she can balance out her expenses while completing her payment obligations.

loan.use: Purchase construction materials to build a veranda & new doors to replace the ones in bad condition

loan.name: Osmar Silvino

texts.en:
Mr. Osmar is 31 years old and he is currently single. He lives with his parents and he owns an auto repair shop.
He first started thanks to his father, from whom he learned the profession. Nowadays he has all the necessary work elements for any type of auto repair or maintenance work. Seeing the need for service improvement, he went to the Foundation for help.
He requested a loan to get a new air compressor, as the one he has is almost obsolete. Osmar is very thankful to the Foundation for the given opportunity, which will help him improve the service that he gives and get some advantage over the competition.

loan.use: buying an air compressor

loan.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar, de 31 aos de edad ,soltero ,con un hijo , es originario El Jcaro, comarca de Estel , de oficio agricultor ,tiene 5 aos de dedicarse a la siembra de hortalizas. Sus inicios fueron con la ayuda de sus hermanos y cuados comenzaron a medias donde una parte era de el y la comparta con sus hermanos. A los 14 aos comenz a sembrar a media con sus hermanos hasta los 25 ao despus el pudo sembrar su propia parcela, tiene su casa propia producto de las ganancias . Debido a la situacin econmica solo pudo llegar hasta el tercer ao de secundaria y sus padres no tuvieron los recursos para darle una mejor educacin. Sus ventas las realiza en la comunidad y en su hogar. Solicita el crdito para invertir en la siembra de tomate y cebolla comprando insumos que le permitan obtener un mejor rendimiento de su plantacin. Adems una vez finalizado el pago de su crdito ,desea invertir mas capital de trabajo en su plantacin de tomates , ya que es un producto perecedero y de consumo popular, obtener mejores ganancias logrando sustentarse el, mejorar la calidad de vida su familia, su casa y poder brindarle un buen futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Oscar, 31, is single and has a son. Hes originally from El Jcaro, Estel. Hes a farmer. Hes been growing vegetables for five years. He started out with help from his brothers and brothers-in-law sharing equally where part was his and he shared it with his brothers. At the age of 14 he started planting sharing with his brothers until he was 25. Then he was able to plant his own parcel. He now has a house of his own thanks to his profits. Because of the economic situation he was only able to get to 9th grade because his parents did not have sufficient resources to give him a better education. He makes his sales in his community and at home.
He is asking for a loan to invest in tomato and onion crops buying supplies that will make a better yield from his plants possible. In addition, once he pays off the loan he wants to invest in more working capital for his tomato crops because this is a perishable item thats very popular, obtaining better profits thus supporting himself, improving his familys quality of live, his house, and provide his son with a better future.

loan.use: To buy supplies and pay for labor costs for tomato and onion farming.

loan.name: Guadalupe S J Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Guadalupe SJ. Est ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, en Mxico. El grupo est conformado por 10 integrantes. Mireya G. R., es la presidente del grupo, tiene 26 aos, estudi una carrera tcnica y no tiene hijos. La seora Mireya se dedica a la venta de zapato por catlogo, inici hace 1 aos. Sus clientes son de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar este prstamo se siente entusiasmado y con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Solicita este crdito para la compra de zapatos ya que tiene pedidos pendientes por entregar. Tambin espera que con este prstamo obtenga mejores ganancias y mayor clientela, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a su familia con los gastos.
texts.en:
This group is called Guadalupe SJ and located in the State of Puebla in Mexico. The group consists of ten members. Mireya G.R. is the president of the group. She is 26 years old, earned a technical degree, and has no children. Sra. Mireya sells shoes through a catalog and started her business a year ago. Her customers are from the community.

Upon submitting her loan request, Mireya was enthusiastic and eager to excel. She needs this loan to buy shoes since she has outstanding orders that are pending delivery. Mireya also hopes that this loan will improve her earnings and attract more customers so that she can have a better quality of life and support her family with the expenses.

loan.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loan.name: Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.en:
The women's committee "Juan Pablo II" was formed on August 13th, 2010. With a lot of joint effort they are now on their 2nd loan cycle. Besides the independent activity of each member of the group, they also have activities in which they work together, helping each other to reach the ultimate goal: to help their families.
Ms. Amelia L.'s story is touching. She sells milk and she says that through the loan given by the Foundation she was able to improve her business, living conditions and income.
She tells us that her business helped the economy of her family due to the fact that she is the only economic supporter of her household. Ms. Amelia mentions that the activities that the Foundation helps them with are very important because this helps to develop their work capabilities and self-esteem.

loan.use: buying more milk for resale

loan.name: Kuatai Group

texts.en:
The women's committee called "Kuatai" was formed on June 21st, 2010. With a lot of effort they are now in their 2nd loan cycle. Besides their independent work, the group also has joint activities which they engage in to reach the ultimate goal of helping their individual families.
One of the most touching stories is that of Ms. Maria V. who owns a small general store. She says that her business helped her family's economy and living conditions. She is the only supporter of her household and she also has to provide an education to her kids so she says that there was a big change in her family's economy thanks to her business.
According to Ms. Maria, the activities carried out with the help of the Foundation are very important. Thanks to those activities, all the members of the committee have been able to develop their work skills and self-esteem.

loan.use: buying goods for subsequent selling

loan.name: Virgen Maria Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed on January 27th, 2011. With a lot of effort and hard work they are now on their 1st loan cycle. Besides the independent activities each one of the members has, they also work together to built up investment capital so they can help their families.
Ms. Francisca R. who sells vegetables says that the loan helped her to improve her business, living conditions and income. She says that her business helps her household economy (she is the only supporter of the household), and is enabling her to give an education to her kids. Ms. Francisca says that the activities conducted with the Foundation are very important to the committee because they helped improve the committee's work skills and self-esteem.

loan.use: Buying vegetables

loan.name: Las Santanitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS SANTANITAS, Esmeralda C. S. es integrante del grupo, esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en Mxico. Ella se dedica a la venta de chiles secos que inicio hcse 5 aos. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ms chiles secos para incrementar su negocio. Al momento de solicitar este pestamo se siente satisfecha ya que le ayudar a su economa familiar. Ella estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene 3 hijas. Alejandra A. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 27 aos, estudi hasta Bachillerato, es casada y tiene una hija. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, que inicio hace 3 aos. Solicita el prestamo para incrementar ms su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Santanitas, which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Esmeralda C. S. is a member of this group. She started selling dried chili peppers five years ago. Esmeralda is requesting a loan to buy more chili peppers to increase her business. When she applied for this loan, she felt satisfied because the funds would help her family financially. Esmeralda studied through high school and has three daughters.

Alejandra A. is the group president. She is 27 years old and earned her high school diploma. Alejandra is married and has one daughter. She started selling Mexican snacks three years ago. Alejandra is requesting a loan so that she can increase her business even more and provide better service to her customers.

loan.use: Purchase dried chili peppers

loan.name: Mara Eugenia

texts.es:
Mara Eugenia forma parte del banco comunal Las pioneras del comendador perteneciente a la ciudad de Pudahuel.
Ella siempre se ha desempeado en el rubro del comercio, siendo consejera de Avon, vendedora de ropa interior por catlogo y desde hace dos meses comenz a vender aros, collares, pulseras y anillos que ella misma crea y hace. De esta manera tiene clientela que realiza pedidos de su artesana a su gusto, en cuanto a diseos, colores y tamaos. Los clientes de Mara Eugenia son los mismos del negocio de venta por catlogo y clientes particulares que van directo a su casa. Por lo que el horario de su negocio es flexible y relativo.
Ella compra sus materiales en Santiago, donde obtiene hilos, perlas, ganchos para hacer los aros.
Con ste prstamo comprar mas materiales y pretende comprar una maquina de coser.
Mara Eugenia vive con su familia, tiene 3 hijos de 26, 20 y 16 aos de edad, su hija menor la ayuda en la realizacin de su artesana. Su esposo se encuentra con licencia mdica (incapacitado temporalmente para trabajar) con reposo temporal debido a un estrs laboral. Es por esto su motivacin de continuar su negocio y as aumentar sus ingresos.
Su sueo es comprarse una mquina bordadora y un vehiculo, ya que traslada su mercadera con un carro de mano.
Lo que ms le gusta a Mara Eugenia de Fondo Esperanza es que dan la oportunidad de postular a un crdito, el cual ha servido para invertir en su negocio. Adems del compaerismo del grupo y capacitaciones de la asesora de Fondo Esperanza.
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), regin Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como lugar donde se juntan las aguas o lugar de charcos, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el ro Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carn y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la produccin agrcola por la existencia de abundante agua subterrnea.
texts.en:
Mara Eugenia is part of the Las Pioneras del Comendador (The Commanders Pioneer Women) communal bank in the city of Pudahuel. She has always been in commerce. She has been an Avon consultant, has sold catalogue underwear, and for the last two months has started selling earrings, necklaces, bracelets and rings that she designs and makes herself. Thus, her customers can order crafts according to their own taste, design, color and size requirements. Mara Eugenias customers are the same ones from her catalogue sales and private customers that come direct to her house. Because of this, her working schedule is flexible and relative. She buys materials in Santiago where she obtains thread, pearls and hooks to make the hoops. She will use this loan to buy more materials and she intends to also buy a sewing machine.
Mara Eugenia lives with her family. She has three children who are 26, 20 and 16 years of age. Her youngest daughter helps her with the crafts. Her husband is on medical leave (temporarily incapacitated to work) on temporary rest due to work-related stress. This is why shes motivated to stay in business and increase her income. Her dream is to purchase an embroidery machine and a vehicle since she currently transports her goods in a push cart.
What Mara Eugenia most likes about Fondo Esperanza is that it provides the opportunity to acquire a loan which can be invested in her business; in addition, the companionship from the group and the training from the advisor.
Pudahuel is a commune in the west of metropolitan Santiago (capital of Chile). In the Mapudungun (indigenous Mapuche language) it means place where the waters come together or place of puddles, because it has a varied web of waterways made up of the Mapucho River, the Lampa, Carn and Las Cruces marshes which make its land suitable for farming thanks to the abundance of subterranean water.

loan.use: For a sewing machine, thread, pearls and hooks.

loan.name: Book Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit BOOK JOM est cr depuis un an et demi. Il est compos de 25 femmes qui sont du mme village. Elle se sont regroupes par voisinage et par affinit. Le petit commerce est leur activit principale. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO ADI
Madame Jeanne D. debout l'extrme droite de la photo, levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est marie et mre de deux enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confis par des parents.
Elle dveloppe une activit de petit commerce. Elle vend des tissus. Son nouveau crdit lui permettra de renforcer son activit en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.
Avec les bnfices qu'elle ralise partir de son activit elle paye de cours de renforcement pour son fils qui se prpare faire un exement. Elle participe galement la prise en charge de certaines dpenses de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Book Jom was created a year and half ago. It is made up of 25 women who come from the same town. They formed the group through neighbourhood and social connections. Their main activity involves running small businesses. The group belongs to the Village Loan Group of Thieo Adi.
Ms. Jeanne D., standing all the way on the right in the photo with the raised hand, is responsible for the group. She is married and has two children. She also has two other children in her care, who were entrusted to her by their parents.
She has developed a small business selling fabric. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business by raising her ability to buy supplies.
With the profits that she draws from her business, she pays for a review course for her son, who is preparing for an exam. She also contributes to paying for certain household expenses.

loan.use: To buy fabric for resale

loan.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: Bertha es una pequea comerciante, de venta de ropa, zapato, habiendo establecido su negocio hace doce aos, con pequeas compras de mercadera, ahora aumentando sus ventas gracias a los prstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en dos ciclos. Parte de su mercadera la compra en un mercado a proveedores en donde las adquiere a mejor precio, para dar precios accesibles a sus clientes. Con este nuevo prstamo comprara uniformes para damas y caballeros, calcetas, zapatos, que es lo que mas esta siendo demandado por el curso de ao entrante. Lo que est contenta por apoyar a su familia con los gastos ya que tambin tiene los gastos de sus tres hijos que cursan sus estudios.
texts.en:
Bertha is a small businesswoman who sells clothing and shoes. She started her business twelve years ago by making small purchases of merchandise. Now she has increased her sales as a result of the funding she has received from AFODENIC for the past two loan cycles.

Bertha acquires part of her merchandise from the suppliers market where she can get the best price, which enables her to pass on the savings to her customers. With this new loan she will buy uniforms for women and men, socks, and shoes since these items are more in demand for the upcoming year. Bertha is happy to be supporting her family with the expenses as well as the cost of sending her three children to school.

loan.use: Purchase uniforms, socks, and shoes to sell

loan.name: Ana

texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is 50 years old, and she owns a local clothing apparel store. She is married, and her husband is a builder. Both get a lot of business. Thanks to the loan granted by Fundacin Paraguaya and Kiva, this lady invested her profits in the purchase of goods for the garment industry, thus achieving a higher income in sales.
She has a market, nationally and internationally, making clothing, especially sportswear (T-shirts, etc.) of very good quality and at a good price.
Today, Mrs. Ana has improved her revenue and her customers are increasingly satisfied with the excellent care she provides in the shop. This client thanks the Paraguayan Foundation for supporting new clients so they can operate, using Kiva funds to help them earn a better income.

loan.use: Buying fabrics

loan.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
This client is a merchant, dedicated to the purchase and sale of perfume and colognes, and has clientele across the country.
Mr. Cirilo is single and has no children, but is currently living as a couple with a teacher who is taking out the loan with him. He is a very hard worker and has very good references in society.
He thanks the Institution for its good service and he agrees to comply in a timely manner with the responsibility assumed with the company.

loan.use: Buying perfume and cologne

loan.name: Sergio De Jesus

texts.es: Sergio, de 48 aos de edad ,originario de la comarca el Dorado , municipio de Estel, casado, con 5 hijos a su cargo, de oficio agricultor, tiene 40 aos dedicndose a la actividad de siembra de hortalizas ,solo llego hasta tercer grado de primaria ,pues debido a su procedencia humilde , el tener estudios era algo difcil para sus padres as que se dedico a trabajar con su padre en la siembra pues fue su papa quien le enseo a sembrar.Al cumplir los 15 aos ya sembraba por cuenta propia, se caso a los 22 aos . A partir de entonces sembraba hortalizas , comenz con tomate y cebolla en su comunidad. Fruto de su labor logro comprar su propio equipo de trabajo y su vivienda. Actualmente siembra a medias con su suegro una parte de la cosecha de cebolla. Adems tambin tiene otros ingresos como el destace de cerdo actividad que hace cada 5 das dentro de su misma comunidad. Solicita el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos y semilla de tomate. El crdito le permitir obtener mayor ganancia, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ser un productor conocido ,poderlo exportar a Costa Rica .
